materials: Patons® Iced™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 85 yds/77 m) Graphite (97004) 4 balls
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Popcorn = 4 dc in indicated stitch. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook in first of 4 dc and pull dropped loop through. Ch 1 tightly to close popcorn.
measurements: Approx 15” [38 cm] deep x 28" [71 cm] around at lower edge.
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Beg at lower edge, ch 48 loosely. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, taking care to not twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 48 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next st. *Popcorn in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Popcorn in next st. 1 dc in next st. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook in top of ch 3 and pull dropped loop through. Ch 1 tightly to close popcorn – beg popcorn made. *1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Popcorn in next st. Rep from * to last 3 sts. 1 dc in each of last 3 sts. Join with sl st to top of beg popcorn.
4th to 11th rnds: Rep 2nd and 3rd rnds 4 times more.
12th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next st. *Popcorn in next st. Dc2tog. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Popcorn in next st. 1 dc in next st. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 37 sts.
13th rnd: Beg popcorn. *1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Popcorn in next st. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Dc2tog. 1 dc in last st. Join with sl st to top of beg popcorn. 36 sts.
14th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next st. *Popcorn in next st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last st. Popcorn in last st. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
15th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. 16th rnd: As 15th rnd. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Mixology Solids™: 1 ball each of 342 Taupe A, 530 Plum B
RED HEART Mixology Prints™: 1 ball 961 Renaissance Print C
RED HEART® Mixology Swirl™: 1 ball 9961 Renaissance D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 11.5 mm [US P-16]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cowl measures 30” (76 cm) circumference and 7½” (19 cm) high.
gauge: 7 sts = 4” (10 cm); 4 rows = 4” (10 cm). EXACT GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL.
instructions:
With A, ch 14.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, [ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 6 times—7 sc and 6 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, sc in first sc, [ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next sc] 6 times.
Fasten off.
Row 5 (right side): With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in first sc of previous row, ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in same sc, [ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next sc] 6 times.
Rows 6-8: With C, repeat Rows 2-4. Fasten off.
Rows 9-32: Repeat Rows 5-8, changing color as in the following sequence: Work next 4 rows with B, 4 rows with D, 4 rows with A, 4 rows with C, 4 rows with B, and 4 rows with D.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Sew the short edges together. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Heart & Sole®: 2 balls 3936 Bayou

Yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.

instructions:
Ch 50.
Row 1 (right side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, *sc in next 7 ch, skip next ch, sc in next 7 ch, 3 sc in next ch; repeat from * twice, sc in next 7 ch, skip next ch, sc in next 7 ch, 2 sc in last ch, turn—52 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc, *sc in next 7 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 7 sc, 3 sc in next sc, repeat from * twice, sc in next 7 sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in last sc.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 34” (86.5 cm) or desired length. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Sew short ends together. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 991 Desert Camo
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4mm [G-6 US] and 5mm [H-8 US]
Yarn needle
2 plastic cord locks (optional for Drawstring Cord)

[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Cowl measures 10” (25.5 cm) long x 15” (38 cm) circumference.
gauge: 14 sc = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in ribbed pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
COWL
With larger hook, ch 39.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn—38 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 15” (38 cm) or desired circumference. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.

materials: Caron® Cakes™ (7.1 oz/200 g; 383 yds/350 m) Blackberry Mousse  (17036) 2 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Popcorn = 5 dc in next stitch. Drop loop from hook. Re-insert hook from front to back thought first dc and pull up dropped loop. Ch 1 to close popcorn st – popcorn made.
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] deep x 30" [76 cm] around.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 6.
1st set up row:  (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of last 2 ch. Turn.
2nd set up row: Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch.  Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. Turn.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st row:  (RS). Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. Popcorn in next ch (push popcorn to front of work). 1 dc in next ch. *Sl st in first ch of next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Popcorn in next ch of same ch-3 as sl st (push popcorn to front of work). 1 dc in next ch. Rep from * once more. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. Popcorn in next ch (push popcorn to back of work). 1 dc in next ch. *Sl st in first ch of next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Popcorn in next ch of same ch-3 as sl st (push popcorn to back of work). 1 dc in next ch. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. Popcorn in next ch (push popcorn to front of work). 1 dc in next ch. *Sl st in first ch of next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Popcorn in next ch of same ch-3 as sl st (push popcorn to front of work). 1 dc in next ch. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for pat until one side measures 15" [38 cm], ending on a 2nd row of pat.
Proceed in pat as follows, pushing popcorns to RS of work:
1st row:  (RS). Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. Popcorn in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. *Sl st in first ch of next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Popcorn in next ch of same ch-3 as sl st. 1 dc in next ch. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. Sl st in last ch-3 sp. Turn.
2nd row: Sl st in first dc and next popcorn. *Sl st in first ch of next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Popcorn in next ch of same ch-3 as sl st. 1 dc in next ch. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until longer side measures approx 30" [76 cm] ending on a 2nd row of pat. 
Proceed as follows: 
1st row: (RS). Sl st in first dc and next popcorn. *Sl st in first ch of next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Popcorn in next ch of same ch-3 as sl st. 1 dc in next ch. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. Sl st in last ch-3 sp. Turn.
Rep last row until only 2 popcorns rem.
Last row: Sl st in first dc and next popcorn. Sl st in first ch of next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Popcorn in next ch of same ch-3 as sl st. 1 dc in next ch. Sl st in last ch-3 sp.
Fasten off.
Sew side seam.

materials: Bernat® Super Value Stripes™ (5 oz/142 g; 263 yds/241 m) - Candy Store Stripes (73006) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.

instructions:
Ch 92. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first ch. 1 tr in next ch. *1 sc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 1 sc in next tr. *1 tr in next sc. 1 sc in next tr. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 4.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first tr. 1 tr in next sc. *1 sc in next tr. 1 tr in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rnds until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm].
Fasten off.

materials: 1 skein RED HEART® Team Spirit™ 960 Orange/Navy
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
measurements: Cowl measures 5” (12.5 cm) wide and 50” (127 cm) long.
gauge: 12 dc = 4” (10 cm); 6 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COWL
Ch 17.
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook (2 skipped sts do not count as a st), and in each ch across – 15 dc.
Row 2-74: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), turn, dc in each dc across – 15 dc.

materials: 1 skein each 1948 Lavender A, and 1530 Violet B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
Extra hooks in neighboring sizes (see notes)
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Cowl measures 9 x 32" (23 x 81.5 cm) not including fringe.
gauge: 15 sts (including ch sts) = 4" (10 cm); 15 rows = 4" (10 cm) in Moss Stitch.
instructions:
NOTES
1. It is highly recommended that you watch Marly Bird’s tutorial videos on planned color pooling before beginning this project.
2. You may have to tighten or loosen some stitches as you go in order to keep the color pooling intact. Keep a variety of hook sizes on hand to help resize your stitches.
3. Different dye lots of the same colorway may change the number of stitches obtained in any given color. Count the number of stitches YOU get to work through one full sequence, as well as in each color section, and maintain that throughout the pattern.

MOSS STITCH
Ch an even number of sts.
Row 1: Skip 3 ch, sc in next ch, * ch 1, skip 1 foundation ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as a stitch now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Row 3 only for Moss st.

COWL
With A, ch through at least 1 full color sequence, with the last loop on hook being the first loop of a new color just after a color change in the yarn.
Row 1 (right side): Skip 3 ch (counts as as st), sc in the 4th ch from hook, * ch 1, sc around the foundation ch (instead of going into a ch st); repeat from * until 1 full color sequence has been completed on this row. Count the number of sc made in each individual color in the colorway and note it down. Leave remaining ch sts unworked. Undo one st repeat (sc, ch 1), turn.
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Note: As you work this row and all remaining rows, you MUST get the correct number of sc in each color in order to maintain the planned color pooling. Change hook sizes, or actual st used, to get the correct color in place. If you use the same number of sts per color that you counted on Row 1, it will work out.
Row 3 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous right side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the stitch shifts as long as it is off-set by 1.
Row 4 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in the next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Rows 3 and 4 until Cowl measures 31" (78.5 cm), ending on a Row 4 (wrong side row). Fasten off.

FINISHING
Squish or stretch the sts on foundation chain to match the width of the rest of the piece. You can slide the sts around along the foundation chain, as with an adjustable ring. Unravel unused foundation ch sts and weave in yarn tail to secure foundation.

Edging
With right side facing and working across foundation edge, join B with slip st in foundation ch st under last sc of Row 1.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc once more in same ch, * ch 1, sc in next space between sc of Row 1; repeat from * to ch-3 corner space, (ch 1, sc) 3 times in corner space, rotate Cowl to work along long side edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch space at edge of every other row to corner sc, (ch 1, sc) twice around corner sc, rotate Cowl to work along top edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space to corner ch-2 space, (ch 1, sc) 3 times in corner space, rotate Cowl to work along long side edge, (ch 1, sc) in each ch space at edge of every other row to corner sc, (ch 1, sc) twice around corner sc, ch 1, join with slip st in beginning ch 2. Do not turn.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first ch-2 space.
Fasten off.

Seaming
With wrong side facing and B, use whip st to sew seam as indicated in schematic.
Weave in all loose ends.

Fringe
Attach fringes at each ch-1 space around outer edge of Cowl as follows:
Cut 3 strands of yarn, 6" (15 cm) each. Fold strands at center. Use hook to pull center of strands through edge st, then pull ends of strands through the resulting loop and pull tight.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver™: 2 skeins 4145 Candy Stripe
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8mm [US L]
Yarn needle
measurements: Cowl measures 5" [13 cm] wide x 60" [152 cm] circumference.

instructions:
Cowl is worked in a long tube for a double layer thickness. It is worked in continuous rounds with right side facing throughout.
COWL
Ch 30, slip st in first ch, taking care not to twist sts, to form a ring.
Round 1: Sc into first ch and in each ch around.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Repeat Round 2 until piece measures 60" [152 cm] from beginning, slip st in last st of last round. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Sew first and last rounds together to make a circle. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Hygge Charm™ (7 oz/198 g; 432 yds/395 m)
Morning Star (6631) 2 balls
Size U.S. J/10 [6 mm] crochet hook or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch markers.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Bwd cable (Backward Cable) = Skip next 2 post sts and next 2 sc. 1 trfp around each of the next 2 post sts, working behind post sts just made. 1 trfp around each of the 2 skipped post sts.
Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcbp made
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made
Fwd cable (Forward Cable) = Skip the next 2 post sts and 2 sc. 1 trfp around each of the next 2 post sts, working in front of the post sts just made. 1 trfp around each skipped post st.
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times
measurements: Approx 30" (76 cm) across x 20" (51 cm) tall
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions: SIDE PANELS (make 2) Ch 36. 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 35 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 3rd to 35th rows: As 2nd row. 36th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 37 sc. 37th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 38th to 79th rows: Rep 36th-37th rows. 80th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. 81 sc. Fasten off. BACK CABLING See Diagram on page 4. Make an adjustable ring as follows: Wrap yarn around your finger with the yarn tail to the left and under the working yarn. Insert hook through the circle from front to back. Using the working yarn, yarn over and pull up a loop. 1st row: Ch 1. (2 sc. 2 dc. 2 sc) in adjustable ring. Turn. Tighten beg yarn tail to close adjustable ring. 6 sts. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 dcbp around next st. 2 sc between 2 dc of last row. 1 dcbp around next st. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 8 sts. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *2 dcfp around dcbp of last row. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * once more. Turn. 10 sts. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 dcbp. 1 sc between 2 dcfp of last row. 1 dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * once more. Turn. 12 sts. 5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 dcfp. 2 sc in next st. 1 dcfp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * once more. Turn. 14 sts. 6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 dcbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 dcbp around dcfp of last row. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. 1 dcbp. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 16 sts. 7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 dcfp around dcbp of last row. 1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st. Fwd cable. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. 2 dcfp around dcbp of last row. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. Place marker on both sides of 7th row. 18 sts. 8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Skip next st. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in middle of fwd cable of last row. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 18 sts. 9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 2 sc in next st. Bwd cable. (2 sc in next st) twice. Bwd cable. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 18 sts. 10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Skip next st. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in middle of bwd cable of last row. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc.** Skip next st. Rep from * to ** once more. Turn. 18 sts. 11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 3 times more. Turn. 18 sts. 12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 3 times more. Turn. 18 sts. 13th to 14th rows: As 9th-10th rows. 15th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st. Fwd cable. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. 1 dcfp in next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 18 sts. 16th to 119th rows: As 8th-15th rows 13 times. 120th row: As 8th row. 121st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 3 times more. Fasten off. FINISHING With WS facing, seam Side Panels tog using a single crochet join, starting at either center point and seaming to first corner (see Diagram on page 3). Place Back Cabling between the two side panels on the side opposite Side Panel join. Align pointed end of Side Panels with marked 7th row of Back Cabling. Seam along both sides of cabling with a sc join, leaving an opening for hood (see Diagram on page 3). Hood Edging Join yarn with sl st in any st around hood between seams A and B. Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Bottom Edging Join yarn with sl st in any st around bottom edge. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around to 1st center point, *4 sc in same st in center point. 1 sc in each st to next point. Rep from * to last st. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in all loose ends.

materials: Simply Soft Paints (113 g/4 oz; 190 m/208 yds)
Main Color (MC) Sunset (0008) 2
Sizes US H-8 (5mm) or size to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
measurements: Scarf measures approximately 8"/20.5cm wide x 34"/86.5 cm around.
gauge: 2 pattern repeats and 5 rows = 4"/10 cm.
instructions:
SCARF
DESCRIPTION SIZING
Ch 39. Row 1 (RS): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as dc), *sk next 2 ch, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch, sk next 2 ch, dc in next 2 ch; repeat from * across, turn—5 pattern repeats. Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), sk first dc, dc in next dc, *sk next 2 dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 sp, ch 1, dc in next dc, sk next 2 dc, dc in next 2 dc; repeat from * across, turn. Row 3: Ch 3, sk first dc, dc in next dc, *sk next ch-1 sp, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp, sk next ch-1 sp, sk next dc, dc in next 2 dc; repeat from * across, turn. Row 4: Ch 3, sk first dc, dc in next dc, *(3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp, sk next 2 dc, dc in next 2 dc; repeat from * across, turn. Repeat Rows 2–4 until piece measures about 34"/86.5 cm. Do not fasten off. Joining Row: Fold piece, bringing right side of first row up to meet wrong side of last row, working in chains across opposite side of foundation ch and sts of last row (through both thicknesses), sl st in each st across to join piece into a Mobius loop. Fasten off. FINISHING: Using yarn needle, weave in all ends. Block lightly, if desired.

measurements: Neck Wrap measures approximately 41/2"/11.5cm high x 17"/43cm long, not including ruffle.
gauge: In pattern, Collar measures about 4 x 17"/10 x 43cm (before blocking).
instructions: SPECIAL STITCH PSt: Paris Stitch—(2 dc, ch 2, sc) in indicated stitch or space. NOTE The A-colored collar is worked first. The ruffle is then worked across one short side edge and one long edge only. NECK WRAP Collar With larger hook and A, ch 49. Row 1 (RS): (Dc, ch 2, sc) in 4th ch from hook (first PSt made), *sk next 2 ch, (2 dc, ch 2, sc) in next ch (Pst made); repeat from * across, turn—16 Psts. Row 2: Ch 3, (dc, ch 2, sc) in first ch-2 sp, Pst in each ch-2 sp across, turn. Repeat Row 2 until piece measures about 4"/10cm from beginning, end with a WS row. Fasten off. Edging Round (RS): With larger hook and RS facing, turn piece so foundation ch is at top; working across opposite side of foundation ch, join B with sl st in first ch, ch 1, 3 sc in same ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in ends of rows, sc evenly spaced across side edge; 3 sc in first st of last row of piece, sc in each dc (sk the sc and ch-2 sps) across to last dc, 3 sc in last dc; working in ends of rows, sc evenly spaced across side edge; join with sl st in first sc, turn. Do not fasten off. Ruffle Note: In next row, work across one side edge and one long edge only. Row 1 (begin ruffle): Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across side edge and following long edge (do not work across the other side edge and long edge), turn. Row 2: Ch 2, dc in each sc across, turn. Rows 3 and 4: Ch 2, 2 dc in each dc across, turn. Fasten off. Side Edging: Join A with sl st in first st of Row 4 (at top of ruffle), to work across unworked side edge; working in ends of rows, ch 1, sc in end of first row, [ch 3, sc in end of next row] 4 times; working in sts of Round 1, *ch 3, sc in next sc; repeat from * across to end of side edge. Fasten off. TIES (make 4) With smaller hook and B, ch 41. Row 1: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—40 sl sts. Fasten off. FINISHING With RS facing, sew one tie to straight side edge of wrap (side edge without ruffle), 3/4"/2cm from top. Sew another tie 2 1/2"/6.5cm below first tie. Sew remaining two ties to other side edge (with ruffle) opposite the first 2 ties (sew these ties to the edge of the collar, not to the edge of the ruffle). Using yarn needle, weave in all ends. Block collar section, to finished measurements, if desired.

materials: Caron ® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m) Version 1 or Version 2
Fuchsia Foliage (01020)  2  braids
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp  = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Hdcbl  = Half double crochet in back loop only of next stitch
Hdcfl = Half double crochet in front loop only of next stitch
Scfl  = Single crochet in front loop only of next stitch
Sl stbl = Slip stitch in back loop only of next stitch.
measurements: Approx 25 ½ " [65 cm] around x 12" [30.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Before working with Caron® x Pantone™ multi-shade yarn braid, separate each color link and wind into 5 separate balls for each braid.
• Each color link will be referenced by its Pantone™ color # (see label).
• Designate each different shade of the 5 separate yarn balls as Contrast A, B, C, D and E as noted in Materials section (or as desired).
• Due to finite amount of yarn in each shade, pattern gauge must be matched to ensure successful results
• Worked over foundation ch multiple of 4 ch + 3. 
• When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.

TOP and BOTTOM  
(make 2 pieces alike)
With A, ch 79. See chart on page 3.  
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 77 sts.
2nd row:  Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 1 dcbp around each st to end of row. Join B. Break A. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 2 (counts as  1 hdc). 1 hdcbl in each st to end of row. Join C. Break B. Turn.
4th row: With C, ch 1. 1 scfl in first st. *Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 scfl in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Join D. Break C. Turn.
5th row: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join C. Break D. Turn.
6th row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join B. Break C. Turn.
7th row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 hdc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Join E. Break B. Turn.
8th row: With E, ch 1. 1 scfl in each st to end of row. Turn.
9th row:   Ch 1. 1 sl stbl in each st to end of row. Turn.
10th row:  Ch 2 (counts as 1 hdc). 1 hdcfl in each sl st to end of row. Join B. Break E. Turn.
11th row:  With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *1 sc in next st. Draw up a long loop in front loop only of sc 4 rows below (7th row). Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook – extended sc made. Skip next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to end of row. Join C. Break B. Turn.
12th row: With C, ch 1. 1 scfl in each st to end of row. Join D. Break C. Turn.
13th row:  With D, ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Ch 1. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Join E. Break D. Turn.
14th row: With E, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join D. Break E. Turn.
15th row: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Join C. Break D. Turn.
16th row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 hdc in next ch-1 sp.  1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Join D. Break C. Turn.
17th row:  With D, ch 2 (counts as first hdc). 1 hdcbl in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
FINISHING:
Joining Top and Bottom:  Place WS of Top and Bottom tog to form a mirror image along final rows. With RS facing, join B with sl st and cont to sl st Top and Bottom tog, through back loops only along final rows to create a sl st seam. Sl st seam will create ridge on RS. Fasten off. Sew short edges tog.

A beautiful color is combined with a beautiful pattern in this stunning cowl. Crocheted in squares that are joined-as-you-go, so there is no seaming. 
Round 3: Slip st into ch-2 space of first V-st, ch 4 (counts as first tr) (2 tr, ch 3, 3 tr) in same ch-2 space (corner made), [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, (3 tr, ch 3, 3 tr) in ch-2 space of next V-st (corner made)] 3 times, ch 3, sc in last ch-3 space, ch 3; join with slip st in top beginning ch-4—24 tr, 4 sc, and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 1, picot in same tr as join, [sc in next 2 tr, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-3 corner space, sc in next 2 tr, picot in next tr, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in next sc, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in next tr] 3 times, sc in next 2 tr, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-3 corner space, sc in next 2 tr, picot in next tr, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in next sc, 2 sc in last ch-3 space; join with slip st in first sc—16 picots. 
Fasten off.
Motif #2 
Work same as motif #1 through Round 3—24 tr, 4 sc, and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Note: Motif #2 is now joined to motif #1 as the next round is worked. The motifs are joined at 5 picots across one side. 
Round 4: Ch 1, picot in same tr as join, sc in next 2 tr, (sc, picot-join, sc) in next ch-3 corner space, sc in next 2 tr, picot-join in next tr, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot-join in next sc, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot-join in next tr, sc in next 2 tr, (sc, picot-join, sc) in next ch-3 corner space, [sc in next 2 tr, picot in next tr, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in next sc, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in next tr, sc in next 2 tr, (sc, picot, sc) in next ch-3 corner space] twice, sc in next 2 tr, picot in next tr, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, picot in next sc, 2 sc in next ch-3 space; join with slip st in first sc—16 picots. Fasten off.
Cowl measures 11” wide x 33” circumference (28 x 84 cm)
Special Stitches
dc-cl (3 double crochet cluster) = Yarn over, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook (2 loops remain on hook); [yarn over, insert hook in same stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 2 times, yarn over, draw through all 4 loops on hook.
picot = (sc, ch 5, sc) in indicated stitch or space.
picot-join = (sc, ch 2, slip st in corresponding picot of neighboring motif, ch 2, sc).
V-st = (dc, ch 2, dc) in indicated stitch or space.
Notes
1. Cowl is made from 12 motifs, arranged into 2 rows of 6 motifs each.
2. Each motif is worked in joined rounds with right side facing at all times.
3. Motifs are joined to neighboring motifs using a “join-as-you-go” technique as the last round is worked. Hold the motifs with wrong sides together and stitches matching.
4. Make and join motifs to neighboring motifs according to Assembly Diagram and instructions.
COWL
Motif #1
Ch 4, join with slip st in first ch form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 7 (counts as first dc and ch 4), (dc-cl, ch 4, dc, ch 4, dc-cl) in ring, ch 4; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-7—2 dc, 2 dc-cl, and 4 ch-4 spaces.
Round 2: Ch 5, dc in same st as join (counts as first V-st), [ch 1, (dc-cl , ch 3, dc-cl ) in next ch-4 space, ch 1, V-st in next st] 3 times, ch 1, (dc-cl , ch 3, dc-cl) in last ch-4 space, ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—4 V-sts and 4 ch-3 spaces.

materials: RED HEART® Shimmer®: 1 ball each of 1932 Zebra A and 1403 Pewter B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.0mm [J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Scarf measures: 7½” (19 cm) x 70” (178 cm) before seaming.
gauge: 14 sts (1 chevron pattern repeat) = 3½” (9 cm). 4 rows = 2½” (6.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
With A, ch 31.
Row 1 (right side): 2 dc in 4th ch from hook, *dc in each of the next 3 ch, [dc3tog over next 3 ch] twice, dc in each of the next 3 ch*, 3 dc in each of next 2 ch; repeat from * to * once, 3 dc in last ch; turn—2 chevrons.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in first dc, *dc in each of next 3 dc, [dc3tog over next 3 dc] twice, dc in each of the next 3 dc*, 3 dc in each of next 2 dc; repeat from * to * once, 3 dc in top of ch-3 turning ch; turn.
Rows 3-4: Repeat Row 2. Change to B at end of Row 4. Fasten off A.
Rows 5-112: Repeat Row 2, working in the following color sequence: *4 rows B; 4 rows A; repeat from * ending with 4 rows B. Fasten off, leaving a long sewing length.
Finishing
Weave in ends. Block scarf. Sew short ends together matching sts.
Side Edging
Row 1: With right side facing, join B with slip st around the post of first row-end dc on one side of scarf, ch 1, work 2 sc in each row-end st around edge of scarf, join with a slip st in first sc—224 sc. Fasten Off.
Repeat Side Edging on other side edge. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Off White (9702) 2 balls

abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 60" [152.5 cm] circumference x 16" [40.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
**Ribbing: With A, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work, without stretching, from beg measures 60" [152.5 cm].** Do not fasten off.
Set-up rnd: (1 sc. Ch 1) 96 times across longer side of ribbing. Join. PM for beg of rnd.
Proceed in pat as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next sc) 4 times. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Rep from *, ending last rep with: (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip last ch-1 sp). Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 5. Skip next (ch-1 sp, 1 dc) twice. From front, sl st in next ch-1 sp 2 rows below. Ch 5. Skip next (1 dc, ch-1 sp) twice. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * ending last rep with: 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip last ch-1 sp. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *(Working behind ch-5 sp, ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc 2 rows below) 4 times. (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Rep from * ending last rep with: (Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip last ch-1 sp). Join.
Rep last 2 rnds until work from beg measures 13½" [34.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Rep from ** to ** as given above.
Sew ribbing around top of Cowl.

materials: AUSTRALIAN SUPERFINE MERINO BY CLECKHEATON 8 PLY 65g/2.3oz balls - Quantity (Raspberry 60) 3
G-6 (4mm) crochet hook or size needed for correct gauge
yarn needle for sewing in ends
measurements: Width (approx) 8½ ins (22 cm), Circumference (approx) 30 ins (76 cm)
gauge: 17dc and 10½ rows to 4” (10cm) over dc fabric.
instructions:
COWL
Make 4ch, leaving a 4” (10cm) end.
Foundation round – Skip 3ch (counts as 1dc), yo, insert hook under 2 strands of next ch, draw lp through, yo and draw through 1 lp (ch made), (yo and draw through 2 lps) twice (dc made), * yo, insert hook under 2 strands of ch made, draw lp through, yo and draw through 1 lp (ch made), (yo and draw through 2 lps) twice (dc made), rep from * 132 times, sl st in 3rd ch at beg to form a ring, taking care not to twist Foundation sts … 135dc.
1st round – 1ch, 1sc in same st as sl st, (5dc CL in next dc, 1sc in each of next 3dc) 24 times, turn (to work from inside of ring), Crab st in back lp only of each rem 38dc, turn, sl st in first sc.
2nd round – 3ch, (1dc in 5dc CL, 1dc in each of next 3sc) 24 times, 1tr in back lp of each of next 38dc from Foundation round (working behind Crab sts), sl st in 3rd ch at beg.
3rd round – 1ch, 1sc in same st as sl st, 1sc in each of next 2dc, (5dc CL in next dc, 1sc in each of next 3dc) 23 times, turn, Crab st in back lp only of each rem 40 sts, turn, sl st in first sc.
4th and all even number rounds – 3ch, 1dc in each st to Crab sts, 1tr in back lp of each st behind Crab sts, sl st in 3rd ch at beg.
5th round – 1ch, 1sc in same st as sl st, (5dc CL in next dc, 1sc in each of next 3dc) 23 times, turn, Crab st in back lp only of each rem st, turn, sl st in first sc.
7th round – 1ch, 1sc in same st as sl st, 1sc in each of next 2dc, (5dc CL in next dc, 1sc in each of next 3dc) 22 times, turn, Crab st in back lp only of each rem st, turn, sl st in first sc.
9th round – 1ch, 1sc in same st as sl st, (5dc CL in next dc, 1sc in each of next 3dc) 22 times, turn, Crab st in back lp only of each rem st, turn, sl st in first sc.
11th round – As 7th round, working 5dc CL patt 21 times.
13th round – As 9th round, working 5dc CL patt 21 times.
15th round – As 7th round, working 5dc CL patt 20 times.
Cont creating diagonal line, working 5dc CL patt 20 times in 17th round, 19 times in 19th and 21st rounds, then 18 times in 23rd and 25th rounds and so on until Cowl measures approx 8½” (22cm) from beg or near end of 3rd ball, ending with a 4th patt round.
FINISHING
DO NOT PRESS. Join beg and end of Foundation round with yarn end.

instructions:
Ch 44. Join in rnd with sl st to first chain, being careful to not twist chain. 
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each ch around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 44 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rnds until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a 3rd rnd. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m)
Contrast A Concord Crush (68019) 1 O’Go
Contrast B Pave the Way (68022) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] tall x 26" [66 cm] around.
gauge: 9 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Start crocheting!
• Cowl is worked in rnds which are joined and turned, alternating RS and WS of work.
• Cowl is reversible. Rnds are noted as RS and WS just for clarity since work is turned at end of each rnd.
• When working into horizontal bar of sts, always work into bar at side of work facing you.
• Do not cut yarn at end of rnds when changing colors.
COWL
With A, ch 58. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist.
Foundation rnd:  (RS). With A, ch 1. Working in back "bumps" of foundation chain, 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
1st rnd: (WS). With B, ch 1. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked at side of work facing – see diagram). Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. Turn.
2nd rnd: (RS). With A, as 1st rnd.
Rep last 2 rnds for pat until work from beg measures 16" [40.5 cm], ending on a 2nd rnd. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each of 9925 Really Red A, 4601 Off White B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6]
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cowl measures 30” (76 cm) circumference and 6” (15 cm) high.
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 14 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet worked in back loops only and carrying another strand under the stitches. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COWL
With B, ch 120; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Carry another strand of B under the working strand, working in back bumps of beginning ch, sc in same ch as joining slip st and in each ch around; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—120 sc. Place a marker in last sc made. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Drop the carried strand of B and begin carrying a strand of A.
Note: In all following rounds, work sc stitches in the back loops only.
Round 2: *With B, sc in next st; with A, sc in next st; with B, sc in next st; with A, sc in next 7 sts; repeat from * around—12 pattern repeats.
Drop the strand of A and begin carrying a second strand of B.
Round 3: With B, sc in each st around.
Drop the carried strand of B and begin carrying a strand of A.
Round 4: Repeat Round 2.
Round 5: *With B, sc in next st; with A, sc in next st; with B, sc in next st; with A, sc in next 3 sts; with B, sc in next st; with A, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around.
Round 6: *With B, sc in next st; with A, sc in next st; with B, sc in next st; with A, sc in next 2 sts; with B, sc in next 3 sts; with A, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around.
Round 7: *[With B, sc in next st; with A, sc in next st] twice; with B, sc in next 5 sts; with A, sc in next st; repeat from * around.
Round 8: *With B, sc in next st; with A, sc in next st; with B, sc in next st; with A, sc in next 2 sts; with B, sc in next st; with A, sc in next st; with B, sc in next st; with A, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around.
Rounds 9 and 10: Repeat Rounds 2 and 3.
Rounds 11-21: Repeat Rounds 2-10.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Roving™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 120 yds/109 m) Frosted Plum (77309) 4 balls
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] tall x 30" [76 cm] around.
gauge: 10 sts and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of each rnd does not count as 1 hdc. Ch 72. Join with sl st to first ch, making sure not to twist ch. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first ch. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 72 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcbp in each of first 2 sts. *1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dpfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 16 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around each of first 2 sts. *Skip next dcfp. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dcfp around skipped dcfp. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next dcfp. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dcfp around skipped dcfp. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 16 sts. Skip next dcfp. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dcfp around skipped dcfp. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 6 sts. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next dcfp. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dcfp around skipped dcfp. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
5th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcbp around each of first 2 sts. *Skip next dcfp. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dcfp around skipped dcfp. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next 3 dcfp. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. 1 dcfp around each of 3 skipped dcfp. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next dcfp. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dcfp around skipped dcfp. 1 dcbp around each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 16 sts. Skip next dcfp. 1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dcfp in skipped dcfp. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next 3 dcfp. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 dcfp. 1 dcfp around each of 3 skipped dcfp. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Skip next dcfp.
1 dcfp around next dcfp. 1 dcfp in skipped dcfp. 1 dcbp around each of next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
Rep 3rd to 6th rnds for pat until work from beg measures approx 13½" [34.5 cm], ending on a 6th rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Shetland Chunky ™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 143 yds/131 m)
Red Robin (78705) or Medium Blue (78108) 1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
measurements: Approximately 20" [51 cm] around x 5" [12.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 9 hdc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
Chain (ch) 46 loosely.
Join in round (rnd) with slip stitch (sl st) to first ch, taking care not to twist chain. Place marker for beginning (beg) of rnd.
Note: Before joining, hold ends together and make sure your chain fits over your head. If it’s too short, add more chains.
1st rnd: Right Side (RS). Ch 1. 1 half double crochet (hdc) in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn. 46 hdc.
2nd rnd: Wrong Side (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, work 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
3rd rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, work 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Repeat (Rep) 2nd and 3rd rnds 4 times more. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Chic Sheep by Marly Bird™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 186 yds/170 m)
Contrast A Platinum (5640) 1 ball
Contrast B Sterling (5641) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 30" [76 cm] around and 18" [45.5 cm] deep at point.
gauge: 2½  clusters and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat
instructions:
Note: Carry color not in use loosely along side of work. 
Stripe Pat
With A, work 2 rows.
With B, work 2 rows.
These 4 rows form Stripe Pat.
With A, ch 10. 
1st row:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 2. Skip next 3 ch. *(Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in next ch or st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – 3 dc cluster made. Ch 2. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. Break A. Join B. 
2nd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 7. Skip next ch-2 sp, next 3 dc cluster, and next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 2. 3 dc cluster in first sc. Ch 2. 1 sc in ch-7 sp. Ch 2. (3 dc cluster. Ch 2. Tr) all in last sc. Turn. Drop B. Join A.
Proceed as follows in Stripe Pat:
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Ch 7. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 2. *3 dc cluster in next sc. Ch 2. 1 sc in next ch-7 sp. Ch 2. Rep from * to last sc. (3 dc cluster. Ch 2. Tr) all in last sc. Turn. 
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are now complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 1st and 2nd rows 16 times more. Fasten off. 
Border: 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st to first sc worked in last row. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around outer edge of Shawl, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. Skip next st. Rep from * around, working 3 sc in each corner. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew points tog to form Cowl.

materials: RED HEART® Grande™: 6 balls
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 16 mm [US Q]
Large eye yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cowl measures 24” wide x 56” circumference (61 x 142 cm).
gauge: 4 sc = 3¾” (9.5 cm); 4 rows = 3½” (9 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Notes
1. Cowl is worked in joined rounds with right side facing.
2. You may prefer to use a crochet hook to weave in ends.
COWL
Ch 61.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 3, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, ch 3, skip last 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc and 20 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 1, 3 sc in same space and in each ch-3 space around; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc.
Rounds 4–27: Repeat Rounds 2 and 3 twelve times.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast B Light Country Peach (9737) 1 ball
Contrast D Oﬀ   White (9702) 1 ball
Contrast E Light Country Blue (9709) 1 ball
Contrast F Country Blue (9710) 1 ball
Contrast G Dark Country Blue (9711) 1 ball
Caron® Simply Soft® Heathers™ (5 oz/141.7 g, 250 yds/228 m) Contrast A Gray Heather (H9509) 1 ball
Contrast C Woodland Heather (H9503) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
V-st = (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in indicated st.
measurements: Approx 26" [66 cm] in circumference x 17" [43 cm] deep.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Stripe Pat
Work 1 rnd of each color: B, C, D, E, F, B, G, A
These 8 rnds form Stripe Pat.
COWL
**Ribbing: With A and U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook, ch 8. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work, without stretching, from beg measures 26" [66 cm].** Do not fasten oﬀ.
1st rnd: Work 72 sc across longer side of ribbing. Join with sl st to first sc.

Proceed in Stripe Pat as follows:
1st rnd: With B, ch 4. 1 dc in same sp as sl st – beg V-st made. *Skip next sc. V-st in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Skip last sc. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. Fasten oﬀ. 36 V-sts.
2nd rnd: Join C with sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg V-st in same sp as sl st. *V-st in ch-1 sp of next V-st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4.
First 2 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last rnd until work from beg measures 14½" [37 cm]. Fasten oﬀ.
Rep from ** to ** as given above. Sew ribbing around top (last rnd) of Cowl.
FINISHING
Sew sides of Ribbings.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A White (9701) 1 ball
Contrast B Harvest Red (9763) 1 ball
Contrast C Autumn Red (9730) 1 ball

gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed in new color. Stripe Pat With A, work 1 rnd. With B, work 2 rnds. With C, work 4 rnds. With B, work 2 rnds. With A, work 1 rnd. These 10 rnds form Stripe Pat. With A, ch 100. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care to not twist chain. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join B with sl st to first sc. Break A. 100 sc. 2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. First 2 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete. Cont in Stripe Pat, rep 2nd rnd until Stripe Pat has been worked 4 times. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Lincoln Fog™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 190 yds /174 m)
Contrast A Pool (12016) 1 ball

Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.

measurements: Approx 25" [63.5 cm] around x 18" [45.5 cm]
gauge: 11.5 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note:  Carry colors not in use loosely up WS of Cowl.
Stripe Pat
With A, 1 rnd.
With B, 1 rnd.
With C, 1 rnd.
These 3 rnds form Stripe Pat.
With A, ch 88. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd:  Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch.  Rep from * to last ch. Ch 1. Skip last ch. With B, join with sl st to top of ch-3.
2nd rnd:  With B, *ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around.  With C, join with sl st to first ch.
3rd rnd:  With C, ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last sc. Ch 1. Skip last sc. With A, join with sl st to top of ch-3.
First 3 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete. Rep 2nd and 3rd rnds, cont in Stripe Pat until work from beg measures approx 18" [45.5 cm] ending on a 3rd rnd with A.
