materials: Caron® Anniversary Cakes™ (35.3 oz/1000 g; 1061 yds/970 m)
Contrast A Cookie Parade (20007) 1 ball
Contrast B Peachy Part-ay (20001) 1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4” [10 cm]
instructions:
NOTES:
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
• After working 1st row with RS facing, pat rep is worked with 2 rows with WS facing and 2 rows with RS facing.
• Cowl is reversible.
With A, ch 25.
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Join B. Turn. 24 sts.
2nd row: (WS). With B, ch 1. 1 sc in 1st dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next d. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Do not turn.
3rd row: (WS). With A, sl st to 1st sc. Ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 sc in last dc. Turn.
4th row: (RS). With B, sl st to 1st sc. Ch 3. *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 sc in last dc. Do not turn.
5th row: (RS). With A, sl st to 1st dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in 1st dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
6th row: (WS). With B, sl st in 1st dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in 1st dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Do not turn.
Rep 3rd to 6th rows until work from beg measures 60" [152.5 cm]. Fasten off leaving a long end.
Twist one end 180 degrees to create infinity loop. Sew short ends tog.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool Worsted™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 210 yds /192 m)
Contrast A Plum Heather (77307) 1 ball
Contrast B Dark Gray Marl (77252) 2 balls
Contrast C Aran (00202) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 14" [35 cm] deep x 32" [81.5 cm] around.
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook. Drop previous color from hook, draw new color through loops and proceed.
TRIANGLE (make 16) 
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ring. (Ch 3. 3 dc) twice in ring. Ch 3. With B, join with sl st to top of ch-3.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in first 3 dc. *(2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) all in ch-3 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * once more. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) all in next ch-3 sp. With C, join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: With C, ch 1. *1 sc in each sc to corner ch-2. (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) all in ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. With B, join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: With B, ch 2 (does not count as hdc). *1 hdc in each sc to corner ch-2 sp. (2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) all in ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. With C, join with sl st to first hdc.
5th rnd: With C, ch 2 (does not count as hdc). *1 hdc in each hdc to corner ch-2 sp. (2 hdc. Ch 2. 2 hdc) all in ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. With B, join with sl st to first hdc.
6th rnd: With B, ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in each hdc to corner ch-2 sp. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) all in ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each of next 8 hdc. With C, join with sl st to top of ch-3.
7th rnd: With C, ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dc in each dc to corner ch-2 sp. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) all in ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
Fasten off.
Assembly
See Diagram on page 2 for Assembly. Sew Triangles tog through back loops. Sew edge A to B.

pattern_name: Comme Ci Comme Ca Crochet Cowl
materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz /100 g; 127 yds/116 m)
Main Color (MC) Dane Gray (01003) 2 braids
Contrast Olive Oil (01007) 1 braid
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Approx 21" [53.5 cm] circumference x 13" [33 cm] deep.
gauge: 12 sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• Before working with Caron x Pantone multi-shade yarn braid, separate each color link and wind into 5 separate balls.
• Each color link will be referenced by its Pantone color # (see label).
• Designate each different shade of the 5 separate yarn balls as Contrast A, B, C, D and E as noted in Materials section (or as desired).
• Due to finite amount of yarn in each shade, pattern gauge must be matched to ensure successful results.
• Carry MC loosely up WS of work when not in use.
• Ch 3 at beg of rnds counts as dc throughout.

Stripe Pat
1st and alt rnds: With MC.
2nd rnd: A as Color 1; B as Color 2.
4th rnd: C as Color 1; D as Color 2.
6th rnd: E as Color 1; A as Color 2.
8th rnd: B as Color 1; D as Color 2.
10th rnd: E as Color 1; C as Color 2.
These 10 rnds form Stripe Pat. 
With MC, ch 64. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist chain. See diagram on page 3.

1st rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each ch around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 64 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 dcbp around next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-2.

Proceed in pat as follows:
Note: Each row of pat is worked in back loops only.

1st rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join Color 1 with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With Color 1, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 sc. With Color 2, 1 dc in each of next 4 sc. *With Color 1, 1 dc in each of next 4 sc. With Color 2, 1 dc in each of next 4 sc. Join MC with sl st to top of ch-3. Break Color 1 and 2.
3rd rnd: With MC, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Working 1 rnd below, skip next 2 sc. 1 tr in rem front loop of next sc. Working in current rnd, skip next dc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join Color 1 with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: With Color 1, ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. With Color 2, 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. *With Color 1, 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. With Color 2, 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join MC with sl st to top of ch-3. Break Color 1 and 2.
5th rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in next dc. *Working 1 rnd below, 1 tr in rem front loop of first tr to the right of last st (skipping 2 sc). Working in current rnd, skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join Color 1 with sl st to first sc.

First 5 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete. Rep 2nd to 5th rnds 8 times more (Stripe Pat will be completed twice).
Next rnd: With MC, ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each st around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp around next dc. 1 dcbp around next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dcfp.
Fasten off.

materials: 1 ball each 3962 Sugarcane A
9942 Cappuccino B
Susan Bates® Double-End Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10½]
Yarn needle
9 locking stitch markers: 8 of same color, 1 of contrasting color
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cowl measures 12" long x 30" circumference (30.5 x 76 cm).
gauge: 14 sts = 4" (10 cm); 14 rows = 4" (10 cm) in rib st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: With A, ch 107; place contrast color marker in loop on hook for beginning of round. Row 1 (Set Up Row): Working in back bars, insert hook in first ch from hook, yarn over and pull up a loop, *[insert hook in next ch, yarn over and pull up a loop] across until ¾ of hook is covered with loops, turn work to wrong side, slide sts to opposite end of hook; with B, yarn over, draw through first st, [yarn over, draw through 2 loops] across** until 3 or 4 loops remain on hook, turn work to right side, slide sts to opposite end of hook, pick up A; repeat from * across until all ch are worked, ending last repeat at **—108 Tss. Round 2: Taking care not to twist Row 1, bring marked end of row to hook, with A, Tss in first marked st, move marker to loop just made, TwTss in next st (first rib st made), *work rib sts until ¾ of hook is covered with loops, turn work to wrong side, slide sts to opposite end of hook; with B, [yarn over, draw through 2 loops] around** until 3 or 4 loops remain on hook, turn work to right side, slide sts to opposite end of hook, pick up A; repeat from * until all sts are worked, ending last repeat at **—54 rib st pairs. Place marker in every 12th st around to mark first st of every 6th rib st pair. Contrast marker now denotes first st of round and first st of first rib st pair. Move all markers up as each marked st is worked. Round 3: *With A, [Tss2tog in next rib, rib st in next 3 rib st pairs, back bar inc, rib st in next 2 rib st pairs] around until ¾ of hook is covered with loops, turn work to wrong side, slide sts to opposite end of hook; with B, [yarn over, draw through 2 loops] around** until 3 or 4 loops remain on hook, turn work to right side, slide sts to opposite end of hook; repeat from * until all sts are worked, ending last repeat at **—108 sts. Round 4: *With A, [Tss2tog in next 2 sts, TwTss in next st, rib st in next 2 rib st pairs, Tss in next st, back bar inc, rib st in next 2 rib st pairs] around until ¾ of hook is covered with loops, turn work to wrong side, slide sts to opposite end of hook; with B, [yarn over, draw through 2 loops] around** until 3 or 4 loops remain on hook, turn work to right side, slide sts to opposite end of hook; repeat from * until all sts are worked, ending last repeat at **—108 sts. Rounds 5–38: Repeat last 2 rounds 17 times. Round 39: *With A, work rib sts around until ¾ of hook is covered with loops, turn work to wrong side, slide sts to opposite end of hook; with B, [yarn over, draw through 2 loops] around** until 3 or 4 loops remain on hook, turn work to right side, slide sts to opposite end of hook; repeat from * until all sts are worked, ending last repeat at **—54 rib st pairs. Fasten off B. Round 40: With A, [insert hook under next vertical bar as if to Tss, yarn over and pull through both loops on hook, insert hook under next vertical bar as if to TwTss, yarn over and pull through both loops on hook] around to marked st, Tss in marked st, yarn over and pull through both loops on hook. Fasten off. FINISHING: Block lightly to finished measurements and to reduce curl. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Colorscape™: 2 balls 6342 Montreal
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10½]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parenthesis the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Cowl measures 9½" [24 cm] wide x 60" [152 cm] circumference at neckline.
gauge: 2 pattern repeats ([3 dc, ch 4, tr] twice) = 4" [10 cm]; 5 rounds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 160 sts, slip st in first ch, taking care not to twist sts, to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around, slip st in first sc – 160 sc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), (2 dc, ch 4, tr) in same sc, skip next 3 sc, *(3 dc, ch 4, tr) in next sc, skip next 3 sc; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 40 repeats of (3 dc, ch 4, tr).
Round 3: Slip st in each st to ch-4 space, ch 8 (counts as first tr and ch-4 space), 3 dc in same ch-4 space, (tr, ch 4, 3 dc) in each ch-4 space around, slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-8 – 40 repeats of (tr, ch 4, 3 dc).
Round 4: Slip in each st to ch-4 space, (ch 3, 2 dc, ch 4, tr) in same space, *(3 dc, ch 4, tr) in each ch-4 space around, slip st in top of beginning ch-3. 
Rounds 5-12: Repeat Rounds 3-4 four more times.
Round 13 (Edging): Slip st in each st to ch-4 space, (slip st, ch 4, 4 dc) in each ch-4 space around, slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Grande Metallic™: 2 balls 1870 Vista
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 19mm [US Q]
Large eye yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cowl measures 8” (20.5 cm) wide x 32” (81.5 cm) circumference.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Ch 13.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc), *skip next ch, V-st in next ch, skip next ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * once, dc in next ch, turn—4 dc and 4 V-sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), Bpdc around next dc, *V-st in next V-st, Bpdc around next dc; repeat from * once, dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, Fpdc around next dc st, *V-st in next V-st, Fpdc around next dc; repeat from * once, dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Rows 4–29: Repeat last 2 rows 13 times.
Row 30: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off leaving a 24” (61 cm) tail for sewing.
FINISHING
With wrong side of first and last rows together, whipstitch evenly to seam. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Sweet™: 1 ball 725 Mauve
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 11.50mm [US P-16]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cowl measures 7” [18 cm] wide x 42” [107 cm] circumference.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
COWL
Ch 42, slip stitch in first chain to join in a ring, taking care not to twist sts.
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1 here and throughout), [skip next ch, dc in next ch, ch 1] round to last ch, skip last ch, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 – 21 dc and 21 ch-1 space.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each dc and ch-1 space around – 42 sc.
Round 3: Ch 4, [skip next sc, dc in next sc, ch 1] round to last sc, skip last sc, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 – 21 dc and 21 ch-1 space.
Rounds 4-5: Repeat Rounds 2-3.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Treasure™: 1 ball 1919 Watercolors
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8mm [US L-11]
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 4” x 59” (10 x 150 cm)
gauge: 11 fdc sts = 4” (10 cm); 7 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions: Cowl is worked in joined rounds with right side facing at all times. Round 1 (right side): Beginning with 8” (20 cm) tail, work 150 fdc; taking care to not twist the row, join into a round with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—150 fdc. Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, *ch 3, skip next 2 st, cl in next st, ch 3, skip next 2 st, sc in next st; repeat from * to last 5 st, ch 3, skip next 2 st, cl in next st, ch 3, skip last 2 st; join with slip st in first sc—25 sc, 25 cl, and 50 ch-3 spaces. Round 3: Ch 5 (counts first as dc and ch 2), *sc in next cl, ch 2, dc in next sc, ch 2; repeat from * to last cl, sc in last cl, ch 2; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—25 sc, 25 dc, and 50 ch-2 spaces. Round 4: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), *2 dc in next ch-2 sp, dc in next sc, 2 dc in next ch-2 sp, dc in next dc; repeat from * to last ch-2 sp, 2 dc in last ch-2 sp; join with slip st in top ch of beginning ch-3—150 dc. Rounds 5-7: Repeat Rounds 2-4 once. Fasten off. FINISHING: With yarn needle and beginning tail, sew the first and last stitches of Round 1 together. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Autumn Red (9730) 1 ball
Size U.S. H-8 (5 mm) or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Beg-hdc-cl = Ch 2. (Yoh and draw up a loop) twice in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through 4 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through remaining 2 loops on hook.
Hdc-cl = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through 6 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through remaining 2 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] wide x 24" [61 cm] around.
gauge: 3 repeats and 11 rows = 5" [12.5 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Ch 112. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist chain. 
Rnd 1: Ch 1, sc in first ch, ch 1, *sk next 3 ch, [(Hdc-cl, ch 2) twice, hdc-cl] in next ch – shell made, ch 1, sk next 3 ch, sc in next ch, ch 1; rep from * around, ending with sk last 3 ch, ch 1; join with sl st to first sc. 14 shells.
Rnd 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in same sp as last sl st, *ch 2, sc in top of center hdc-cl of next shell, ch 2, 3 dc in next sc; rep from * around, ending with ch 2, 1 dc in same sp as first dc; join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Rnd 3: (Beg-hdc-cl, ch 2, hdc-cl) in same sp as last sl st, *ch 1, sc in next sc, ch 1, shell in center dc of next 3 dc; rep from * around, ending with ch 1, hdc-cl in same sp as first hdc-cl, ch 2; join with sl st to top of beg-hdc-cl.
Rnd 4: Ch 1, sc in same sp as last sl st, *ch 2, 3 dc in next sc, ch 2, sc in top of center hdc-cl of next shell; rep from * around, ending with ch 2; join with sl st to first sc.
Rnd 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 1, shell in center dc of next 3 dc, ch 1, sc in next sc; rep from * around, ending with ch 1; join with sl st to first sc.
Rep Rnds 2-5 for pat until piece measures approx 10" [25.5 cm] high, ending on Rnd 3 or 5 of pat. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Mixology Solids™: 1 ball 530 Plum
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 11.5 mm [US P-16]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cowl measures 30” (76 cm) circumference and 7½” (19 cm) high.
gauge: 7 sts = 4” (10 cm); 4 rows = 4” (10 cm). EXACT GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL.
instructions:
COWL
Ch 14.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, [ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 6 times—7 sc and 6 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, sc in first sc, [ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next sc] 6 times.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures about 30” (76 cm) from beginning.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Sew the short edges together. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® BOUTIQUE™ Midnight™: 1 skein 1937 Moonlight
Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K 10½]
yarn needle
abbreviations: [] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Cowl measures 10” wide x 14” long, 28” in circumference.
gauge: 9 sts = 4”; 7 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
COWL 
Leaving a 12” tail, ch 86.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 3, skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from *across, do not turn—21 ch-3 spaces. Work Mobius twist, slip st in first sc to join.
Round 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), dc in same ch as slip st, working across opposite side of foundation ch, *skip next 3 ch, (dc, ch 1, dc) in ch at base of next sc; repeat from * 19 times, skip next 3 ch and ch at base of next sc, working in top of Round 1, **(dc, ch 1, dc) in next sc, skip next ch-3 sp; repeat from ** 20 times, skip next ch-3 sp and sc; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4, do not turn—84 dc; 42 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, skip first st, sc in next ch-1 space, *ch 3, skip next 2 dc, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * 40 times, ch 3, join with a slip st in first sc—42 ch-3 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), dc in same sc as slip st, *skip next ch-3 space, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next sc, repeat from * 40 times, join with a slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4.
Rounds 5-9: Repeat rows 3-4; then repeat row 3.
Fasten off.
FINISHING: Using length of beginning tail, sew any gaps created at join of Round 2. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Multi-ply™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 149 yds/136 m) Deep Creek (76134) 2 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in indicated space. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] deep x 28" [71 cm] around.
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Ch 45. 1st row: Cluster in 5th ch from hook (turning ch counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Ch 1. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. *Ch 3. Cluster in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Ch 2. Skip next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 9 clusters. 2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc and ch 1). Cluster in first ch-2 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc. Ch 3. Cluster) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * ending with 1 sc in 4th ch of turning ch. Ch 2. 1 dc in 3rd ch of turning ch. Turn. Rep last row for pat until work from beg measures approx 28" [71 cm]. Fasten off. Sew short sides tog to form Cowl.

materials: 2 balls of 6579 Evening Star RED HEART® Hygge Charm™
8 mm [US L-11] Susan Bates® Crochet Hook
Yarn needle
measurements: Finished Circumference: 75" [190 cm]; Finished Length: 20" [51 cm]
gauge: 9 half double crochet stitches = 4" [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Chain 47 loosely.
Row 1: Half double crochet in 3rd chain from hook and in each chain across – 45 stitches at the end of this row.
Row 2: Chain 2 (does not count as a stitch here and throughout), turn, half double crochet in each stitch across.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 75" [190 cm] from beginning. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold length in half and sew short edges together to form a loop. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby Chunky™ (5 oz/140 g; 155 yds/142 m)
OR Ombres: 4.25 oz/120 g; 123 yds/112 m)
Main Color (MC) Cozy Gray (96005) 1 2 ball(s)
Contrast A Blue Lagoon (96011) or Dragon Green (96009) 1 1 ball
Size L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 buttons approx 1” [2.5 cm] in diameter.
gauge: 10 sc and 12 rows = 4” [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Cowl
With MC, ch 54 (60).
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
*Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep 
from * to end of ch. Turn. 53 (59) sts. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next 
ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next 
ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. 
Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip 
next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to 
last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. 
Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg 
measures 5 (6)” [12.5 (15) cm], ending on 
a WS row.
Fasten off.
Hood: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to 
8th ch-1 sp of last row.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. 
*Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp.  
Rep from * to last 4 sts. Turn. Leave last 
 4 sts unworked. 35 (39) sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next 
ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next 
ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. 
Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip 
next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to 
last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. 
Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row. 
Rep last 2 rows until Hood measures 
approx 8 (9)” [20.5 (23) cm], ending on a 
WS row. Fasten off.
Fold top of Hood in half with WS facing 
tog. Sew top Hood seam. 
Trim: With RS facing, join A with sl st to 
bottom right corner of Cowl. Ch 1. Work 
1 rnd of sc evenly around entire edge of 
Cowl and Hood. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
Sew buttons to right side edge of Cowl, 
using ch-1 sps at edge of left side for 
buttonholes.

materials: RED HEART® Medley™: 3 balls 940 Volcano
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8mm [US L-11]
Susan Bates® Knitting Needle: 19mm [US 35] Note: only 1 knitting needle is needed for this project.
Large plastic needle or small crochet hook (to weave in ends)
measurements: Cowl measures 13” wide x 38” circumference (33 x 96.5 cm).
gauge: 13 sts = 6” (15 cm); Rows 1–7 = 5” (12.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 30.
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch does not count as a st) and in each ch across—28 hdc. Do not turn.
Row 2 (drop st row): Ch 1, elongate loop on hook and place loop on knitting needle (first drop st made) (Photo 1), skip first hdc, drop st in each remaining hdc across (do not work into the beginning ch)—28 drop sts. (Photo 2) Do not turn. Hold last loop at base (to prevent unraveling) and remove knitting needle from loops. (Photo 3)
Row 3: Draw working yarn up to height of first loop, insert hook into first loop, yarn over and pull up a loop, ch 1, hdc in same loop, hdc in each remaining loop across, turn. (Photo 4)
Row 4: Ch 1, hdc in each st across, do not turn.
Rows 5–55: Repeat Rows 2–4 seventeen times.
Row 56 (drop st row): Repeat Row 2. 
Row 57: Repeat Row 3.
Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Sew short ends together. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Unforgettable®: 1 ball 3945 Parrot
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
measurements: Cowl measures 20½” (52 cm) circumference around neck, and 10” (25.5 cm) high.
gauge: 17 sts = 5” (12.5 cm); 13½ rows = 5” (12.5 cm) in half double crochet (hdc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Cowl is worked back and forth in rows. Short edges are then crocheted together to form a circle. Edging is worked around both edges of circle.
COWL
Ch 35.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across— 34 hdc.
Row 2 (right side): Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, hdc in each st across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, hdc in each st across.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until you have worked a total of 70 rows. 
Seaming Row (wrong side): Turn, hold first and last rows with right sides together and stitches matching, working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across to join piece into a circle. Do not fasten off.
Turn piece so that right side is facing out.
Edging (right side): Ch 1, work 2 sc in the end of every other row all the way around; join with slip st in first sc—70 sc. Fasten off.
With right side facing, draw up a loop of yarn in seam on opposite edge of cowl and repeat Edging.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Super ValueTM (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m) Denim Ragg (53118)  1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approximately (Approx) 16" [40.5 cm] at deepest point x 25" [63.5 cm] around, excluding fringe.
gauge: 15 stitches (sts) and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
Chain (ch) 46.
1st row: [Right Side (RS)]. 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Repeat (rep) from * to end of chain. Turn. 45 stitches (sts).
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 space (sp). Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows for pattern (pat) until work from beginning (beg) measures approximately (approx) 6" [15 cm], ending on a 2nd row.
Increase (inc) point: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. Ch 1. *Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. 46 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in first ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. 47 sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 5 times more. 57 sts.
Decrease (dec) point: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yarn over hook (yoh) and draw through all loops on hook - sc2tog made. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 56 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first sc and first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 55 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 5 times more. Place marker at end of last row. 45 sts.
Cont even in pat until work from marker measures 6" [15 cm], ending on a wrong side (WS) row. Fasten off.
Sew foundation ch and last row together (tog).
Fringe: Cut lengths of yarn 24" [61 cm] long. Taking 2 strands together (tog), fold in half and knot into fringe around entire pointed edge of Cowl. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Patons® Metallic™ (3 oz/85 g; 252 yds/230 m) Metallic Teal (95201) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] deep x 28" [71 cm] around.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Chain (ch) 90.
Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first chain to 
form ring, taking care not to twist chain.
1st round (rnd): Ch 1. 1 single crochet 
(sc) in each ch around. Join with sl st to 
first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as treble crochet). 
1 treble crochet (tr) in each sc around. 
Join with sl st to top of ch 4.
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st 
around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Repeat 2nd to 5th rnds for pattern until 
Cowl measures approx 15" [38 cm], ending 
on a 3rd rnd. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Canadiana™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 205 yds/187 m)
Main Color (MC) Dark Grey Mix (10042)
Contrast A Deep Orchid (10332)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Popcorn St = 3 dc in indicated stitch. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook into first dc and draw dropped loop through.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] deep x 36" [91.5 cm] around.
gauge: 14 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
COWL
Stripe Pat
With MC, work 1 row.
With A, work 1 row.
These 2 rows form Stripe Pat.
With MC ch 128.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 1 hdc). 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Join A. Turn. 126 hdc.
2nd row: With A, ch 2 (does not count as hdc). *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created between stitches of previous row (bar is below loops normally worked)(see diagram). Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 126 hdc.
First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Cont in Stripe Pat, rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm], ending with 1 row of MC. Fasten off.
Sew side edges tog to form Cowl.
BOW
Notes:
1. When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed.
2. Carry color when not in use loosely across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to avoid stranding. 
With MC, ch 84. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist ch.

1st rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Join with sl st to first sc. 84 sc.
2nd rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. With A, 1 popcorn st in next sc. *With MC, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With A, 1 popcorn st in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. With A, 1 popcorn st in next sc. *With MC, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With A, 1 popcorn st in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. With MC, 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
Rep 2nd to 5th rnds for pat until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm], ending on a 3rd or 5th rnd. Fasten off.
Bow Center
With MC, ch 11.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 6" [15 cm]. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Bow Center around Bow and Cowl as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Unforgettable™: 1 ball 9942 Cappuccino
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4.25 mm [US G-6]
Yarn Needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Cowl measures: 7” (18 cm) wide x 30” (76 cm) long, excluding flower
gauge: 4 rows = 2 1/2” (6.5 cm); Row 8 = 7” (18 cm) wide. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Row 1: Ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—16 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3—32 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across, turn—33 sc.
Row 7: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1, here and throughout), dc in first sc (counts as first V-st), *skip next 3 sc, shell in next sc, skip next 3 sc, V-st in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—5 V-sts; 4 shells.
Row 8: Ch 3 (counts as dc, here and throughout), 2 dc in next ch-1 space (half shell made), *skip next 3 dc, V-st in next dc (center dc of shell)**, shell in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across, ending last repeat at **, 3 dc in last ch-1 space (half shell made), turn—4 V-sts; 3 shells; 2 half shells.
Row 9: Ch 4, dc in first dc, *shell in next ch-1 space, skip next 3 dc, V-st in next dc; repeat from * across, turn—5 V-sts; 4 shells.
Rows 10-56: Repeat Rows 8-9 (23 times); then repeat Row 8.
Row 57: Ch 1, sc in each dc and ch-1 space across, sc in top of turning ch, turn—33 sc.
Row 58: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sc, sc in each sc across, turn—32 sc.
Row 59: Ch 1, *sc2tog over next 2 sts; repeat from * across, turn—16 sts.
Row 60: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 61: Repeat Row 59—8 sts.
Rows 62-63: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 64 (button loop): Ch 12, skip first 7 sc, slip st in last sc of Row 63, turn.
Row 65: Ch 1, sc in each of next 12 ch sts; join with a slip st in last sc of Row 63. Fasten off.
FLOWER (button)
Ch 4; join with a slip st in first ch. Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring; join with a slip st in front loop of first sc—12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, (sc, hdc) in first sc, *(hdc, sc) in next sc**, (sc, hdc) next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in remaining back loop of first sc in round below—6 petals.
Round 3: Ch 1, working behind Round 2 in back loops only of sts in Round 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in front loop of first sc—24 sc.
Round 4: Repeat Round 2—12 petals.
Round 5: Ch 1, working in back loops only of sts in Round 3, sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in front loop of first sc—24 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, hdc in first sc, *2 dc next sc, hdc in next sc, ch 1**, (slip st, ch 1, hdc) next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with a slip st in remaining back loop of first sc in round below.
Round 7: Working in back loops only of sts in Round 5, repeat Round 6. Fasten off. Sew flower in place at beginning end of scarf.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (Solids: 3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m; Ombres: 2.8 oz/80 g; 77 yds/70 m)
Version A: Dark Mauve (28323) 3 balls
Version B: Energize (29218) 3 balls
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Popcorn = (Yoh and draw up a loop in indicated st) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all but last loop on hook. Yoh and draw through last 2 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 32" [81.5 cm] around x 11" [28 cm] deep.
gauge: 6 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Ch 56. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 ch. Miss next ch. (Popcorn. Ch 1. Popcorn) in next ch. Miss next ch. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Miss next popcorn. (Popcorn. Ch 1. Popcorn) in next ch-1 sp. Miss next popcorn. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Miss next sc. (Popcorn. Ch 1. Popcorn) in next sc. Miss next sc. *1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Miss next sc. (Popcorn. Ch 1. Popcorn) in next sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * 5 times more. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Miss next popcorn. (Popcorn. Ch 1. Popcorn) in next ch-1 sp. Miss next popcorn. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Miss next popcorn. (Popcorn. Ch 1. Popcorn) in next ch-1 sp. Miss next popcorn. Rep from * 5 times more. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (Popcorn. Ch 1. Popcorn) in first sc. Miss next sc. *1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Miss next sc. (Popcorn. Ch 1. Popcorn) in next sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * 5 times more. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Miss next sc. Join with sl st in first popcorn.
8th and 9th rnds: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (Popcorn. Ch 1. Popcorn) in same sp as last sl st. Miss next popcorn. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Miss next popcorn. (Popcorn. Ch 1. Popcorn) in next ch-1 sp. Miss next popcorn. Rep from * 5 times more. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st in first popcorn.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Miss next sc. (Popcorn. Ch 1. Popcorn) in next sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
11th to 15th rnds: Rep 2nd to 6th rnds once more.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART Mixology Solids™: 1 ball each 631 Jade A and 862 Royal C
RED HEART Mixology Prints™: 1 ball 942 Calypso Print B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook
16mm [US Q] Large eye yarn or plastic needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
measurements: Cowl measures 5½” wide x 68½” circumference (14 x 174 cm).
gauge: 6 sts = 4” (10 cm); 3 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COWL
With A, ch 9.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd chain from hook and in each ch across, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each st across, turn—8 dc.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 21” (53.5 cm); change to B.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 42” (106.5 cm); change to C.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 63” (160 cm); change to B.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 68.5” (174 cm). Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
With wrong sides held together, sew short ends together.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Sashay Team Spirit™: 3 balls 1901 Navy/Gold
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 25mm [US 50]
Large eye plastic needle
stitch marker
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cowl measures 32" circumference x 11" long (81.5 x 28 cm).
gauge: 2 pattern repeats = 4" (10 cm) (one pattern repeat consists of one half double crochet and one chain-1 space); 3 rounds = 4" (10 cm). Gauge is not critical for this project but may affect amount of yarn needed to complete project.
instructions:
COWL
Ch 30.
Round 1: Hdc in 5th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first skipped ch, hdc, and ch-1), *ch 1, skip next ch, hdc in next ch; repeat from * across, ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beg ch—14 hdc and 14 ch-1 spaces. Place marker on first ch-1 space and move up as each round is completed.
Round 2: (Ch 1, hdc) in each ch-1 space around. Do not join.
Repeat Round 2 until cowl measures 11" (28 cm) from beginning; join with slip st in first ch-1 space. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 3953 Butterfly
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
measurements: Cowl measures 8 x 60” (20 x 152 cm)
gauge: 10 sts = 4”; 8 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COWL 
Row 1  (Right Side): Ch 153.
In 4th ch from hook and every ch across, make 1 dc. Ch 3 turn. (150 dc)
Row 2 (Wrong Side):Ch 3 counts as first dc, skip first dc, dc in every dc across.  Ch 1, turn.
Row 3: Sc in every dc across, ch 1, turn. (150 sc)
Row 4: Sc in every ch across. Ch 3, turn.(150 sc)
Row 5: Ch 3 counts as first dc, skip first sc, dc in every remaining sc. Ch 3, turn.
Row 6: Same as Row 2.
Rows  7-14: Repeat rows 3-6 twice.
Rows 15-16: Repeat rows 3-4 once. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With right sides facing, align row ends and sew seam with yarn tail to form circle. Weave in ends. Wrap around neck twice to wear.

materials: Sugar Bush® Canoe™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 95 yds/87 m), Sunset (7008) 5 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
5 buttons.
Tapestry needle.
measurements: Buttoned up: 14" [35.5 cm] wide x 19" [48.5 cm] long. Unbuttoned: 30" [76 cm] wide (including buttonhole edging).
gauge: 2 pattern repeats and 6 rows = 5" [12.5 cm]
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as ddc. Ch 74. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  
1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 
Turn. 73 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next 2 sts. 7 dc in next st - shell made. Skip next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through 4 loops on hook – 3 dc cluster made. Ch 3. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. *(Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 7 times. Yoh and draw through 8 loops on hook – 7 dc cluster made. Ch 3. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 3. Rep from * to last 4 sts. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times. Yoh and draw through 5 loops on hook – 4 dc cluster made. Turn.
4th row: 3 dc in first st. Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. *Skip next ch-3 sp. 7 dc in next st. Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. Skip last ch-3 sp. 4 dc in last st. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *Ch 3. 7 dc cluster. Ch 3. 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next ch-3 sp. 7 dc in next st. Skip next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next sc.
7th to 31st rows: Rep 3rd to 6th rows 6 times more, then 3rd row once more. Do not fasten off. Proceed as follows:
Buttonhole edging: Lie Snoodle flat. Mark sp between 3rd and 6th rows for buttonhole. Ch 3 and turn to work down side of Snoodle. 2 dc in ch-3 sp (makes half shell). *Skip ch 3 from beg of previous row. 1 sc in next sp. 7 dc in sp between 3rd and 6th rows (buttonhole shell made). Rep from * across, ending with 1 sc in last sp. Sl st to beg of foundation row (top edge). Fasten off. (7 full shells and half shell = 8 buttonholes).
Button edging: 1st row: (WS). Join yarn with sl st in first st of 31st row and work 1 row of sc evenly along side edge of Snoodle, adding 2 sc each dc row and 1 sc in final sc row. Turn. 61 sts.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off. Attach buttons evenly up edge of Snoodle to correspond with buttonholes. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft®  (6.1 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Contrast A Iris (9747) 1 ball
Caron® Simply Soft® Paints (5 oz/141 g; 235 yds/215 m) Contrast B Oceana (1004) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 29" [73.5 cm] circumference x 15" [38 cm] wide.
gauge: 12 dc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
NOTES
1. When changing color, do not fasten off old color. Drop old color to wrong side of work and proceed with new color. Carry color not in use up wrong side of work to use again when needed.
2. Cowl is worked in joined rounds, with RS facing throughout. Do not turn at end of rounds.
COWL
With A, ch 92 loosely; taking care not to twist ch, join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (RS): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in each ch around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch—92 dc.
Round 2: Leaving a long tail, yarn over with B and draw up a loop, drop A to wrong side of work; continue with B, sc in same st as join, ch 5, sk next 3 dc, *sc in next dc, ch 5, sk next 3 dc; repeat from * around; join with sl st in first sc—23 sc, and 23 ch-5 sps.
Round 3: With A, ch 1, drop B to wrong side of work; continue with A, sc in same sc as join, working behind the ch-5 sps (push ch-5 sps to front), dc in 3 skipped sts below the next ch-5 sp, *sc in next sc, dc in 3 skipped sts below the next ch-5 sp; repeat from * around; join with sl st in first sc—92 sts.
Round 4: With both A and B held together, sl st in next dc, drop A; with B only, insert hook under next ch-5 sp and work sc in next dc, ch 5, sk next 3 sts, *insert hook under next ch-5 sp and work sc in next dc, ch 5, sk next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with sl st in first sc.
Rounds 5–52: Repeat last 2 rounds 24 times.
Round 53: With both A and B held together, ch 3, drop B; with A only, working behind the ch-5 sps unless otherwise indicated, dc in first skipped st below the next ch-5 sp, yarn over, insert hook under next ch-5 sp and into next skipped st, yarn over and draw up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice, dc in next skipped st, *dc in next sc, dc in first skipped st below the next ch-5 sp, yarn over, insert hook under next ch-5 sp and into next skipped st, yarn over and draw up a loop, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice, dc in next skipped st; repeat from * around; join with sl st in top of beginning ch.
Round 54 (top edging): With B, ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in each dc around; join with sl st in first sc.
Fasten off both A and B.
Lower Edging: With RS facing and working along opposite side of foundation ch, join B with sl st in any ch, ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Using yarn needle, weave in all ends.

materials: Red Heart® Boutique Unforgettable®: 4 balls 3955 Winery (1 ball for hat and 3 balls for cowl)
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]; 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cowl measures 11” wide x 60” circumference (28 x 152.5 cm), including trim. Hat measures 20” (51 cm) circumference at brim.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 8 rows = 4” (10 cm), in double crochet with smaller hook. 13 sts = 4” (10 cm); 7 rows = 4” (10 cm), in double crochet with larger hook.
instructions:
HAT
With smaller hook and leaving a 5” (12.5 cm) tail, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Note At end of each round, skip beginning chains and join with slip st in first dc.
Round 1: Ch 3 (does not count as first st here and throughout), 12 dc into ring; join with slip st in first dc—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, 2 dc in each dc around; join with slip st in first dc—24 dc.
Round 3 and all odd-numbered rounds: Ch 3, Bpdc in each dc around; join with slip st in first dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in first dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—36 dc.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in first 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—48 dc.
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in first 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—60 dc.
Round 10: Ch 3, dc in first 14 dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 14 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—64 dc.
Round 12: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join with slip st in first dc.
Round 14: Ch 3, dc in first 15 dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 15 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—68 dc.
Rounds 15–17: Repeat Rounds 11–13.
Round 18: Ch 3, dc in first 16 dc, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next 16 dc, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—72 dc.
Round 20: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join with slip st in first dc.
Rounds 21–24: Repeat Rows 19 and 20 twice.

COWL
With larger hook, ch 41.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—39 dc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), Fpdc around next 12 dc, Bpdc around next 13 dc, Fpdc around last 13 dc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc in each dc across, turn.
Rows 4–21: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 nine times.
Row 22: Ch 2, Bpdc around next 12 dc, Fpdc around next 13 dc, Bpdc around last 13 dc, turn.
Row 23: Ch 2, dc in each dc across, turn.
Rows 24–41: Repeat Rows 22 and 23 nine times.
Rows 42–61: Repeat Rows 2-21.
Row 62: Repeat Row 3.
Row 63: Ch 2, Fpdc in each dc across, turn.
Rows 64 and 65: Repeat Row 3.
Row 66: Ch 2, Fpdc in each dc across, turn.
Rows 67–120: Repeat Rows 64–66 eighteen times.

Note Take care not to twist piece while joining first and last rows. Hold ends with wrong sides together.

Joining Row: Ch 2, working in opposite side of foundation ch, slip st in first ch of first row, *dc in next st of last row, slip st in next ch of first row; repeat from * across. Do not fasten off.

Edging
First side
Round 1 (right side): *Ch 4, skip next row, working across end of row, sc in next row; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first ch of beginning ch.
Round 2: *Ch 5, remove hook from loop, insert hook from front to back in next ch-4 space, pick up loop and pull through to right side; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first ch of beginning ch. Fasten off.

Second side
Join yarn with slip st in opposite end of joining row.
Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of first side.

FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block piece lightly.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 9931 Grayscale
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
measurements: Cowl measures 26” (66 cm) circumference at widest, 20” (51 cm) circumference around neck, and 9” (23 cm) high.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 8.5 rows = 4” (10 cm) in half double crochet (hdc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 31.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—30 hdc.
Row 2 (right side): Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, hdc in each st across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, hdc in each st across.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until you have worked a total of 60 rows.
Seaming Row (wrong side): Turn, hold first and last rows with right sides together and stitches matching, working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across to join piece into a circle. Do not fasten off.
Turn piece so that right side is facing out.
Edging (right side): Ch 1, work 2 sc in the end of every other row all the way around; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc. Fasten off.
With right side facing, draw up a loop of yarn in seam on opposite edge of cowl and repeat Edging.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby Colors™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 310 yds/284 m) Purple Rainbow (51008) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
4 buttons
abbreviations: Popcorn = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 4 times in next st. Yoh and draw through 9 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] around x 10" [25.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 82.
1st row: Popcorn in 6th ch from hook (turning ch counts as dc, ch 1 and 1 skipped ch). *Ch 1. Skip next ch. Popcorn in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *Popcorn in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next popcorn. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. Popcorn in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip last popcorn. 1 dc in 2nd ch of turning ch. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). Skip first popcorn. *Popcorn in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next popcorn. Rep from * to last st. 1 dc in top of turning ch. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for pat until piece from beg measures approx 10" [25.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Buttonhole Band Edging: **1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to bottom right corner. Ch 1. Work 40 sc evenly along side edge. Turn.**
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc (buttonhole made). 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * twice more. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch to end of row. Fasten off.
Button Band Edging: Rep from ** to ** along opposite side edge.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off at end of 3rd row.
Sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

materials: RED HEART® Heads Up™: 3 balls 275 Bright Coral
Susan Bates Crochet Hook®: 10 mm [US N-15]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Cowl measures 8½” (21.5 cm) wide x 60” (152.5 cm) circumference. Note: To widen Cowl: Add beginning chains in multiples of 4. Increasing the width or length of the Cowl may require additional yarn.
gauge: 6 rows = 4” [10 cm]. (One repeat consists of 1 sc, 1 ch, and 3 dc.) CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 22.
Row 1 (Right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 3, skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across; turn—6 sc, 5 ch-3 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first sc, ch 1, sc in first ch-3 space, ch 1, *3 dc in next sc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 1; repeat from * to last sc, 2 dc in last sc; turn—16 dc (four 3-dc groups and two dc at each end) and 5 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first dc, ch 3, *skip (dc, ch-1, sc, ch-1, dc), sc in next dc, ch 3; repeat from * across to end, sc in top of beginning ch-3; turn—6 sc, 5 ch-3 spaces.
Rows 4-89: Repeat Rows 2-3 until piece measures 60” (152.5 cm), ending on a Row 3.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Right sides together, sew short ends together to form Cowl. Fasten off; weave in all ends.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz /100 g; 127 yds/116 m)
Main Color (MC)  Coconut Cream (01001) 1 braid
Contrast 1 Fuchsia Foliage (01020) 1 braid
Contrast 2  Frozen Berry (01022) 1 braid
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times in next stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Ch 1 to close bobble
measurements: Approx  20" [51 cm] deep x 27" [68.5 cm] around.
gauge: 12 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes: 
• Before working with Caron® x Pantone™ multi-shade yarn braid, separate each color link and wind into 5 separate balls for each braid.
• Each color link will be referenced by its Pantone™ color # (see ball band)

With MC, ch 96 (multiple of 16 ch). Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain. PM for beg of rnd. See diagram on page 3. 

1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 96 hdc. 
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next hdc. *Ch 2. Skip next 6 hdc. [(1 dc. Ch 1) 6 times. 1 dc] all in next hdc – Shell made. Ch 2. Skip next 6 hdc.**  1 sc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * 4 times more, then from * to ** once. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 2. Skip next (sc, ch 2, dc). (Bobble in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next dc) 6 times. Ch 1. Skip next (ch 2, sc).** 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more, then from * to ** once. Join MC with sl st to first sc. Break A. 
4th rnd: With MC, ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. **1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. (1 hdc in next Bobble. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. 1 hdc in next bobble. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch.** 1 hdc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more, then from * to ** once. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 
5th rnd: With B, ch 4 (counts as ddc and ch 4). [(1 dc. Ch 1) twice. 1 dc] in same sp as sl st. *Ch 2. Skip next 6 hdc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 3 hdc. Ch 2. Skip next 6 hdc.** Shell in next hdc. Rep from * 4 times more, then from * to ** once. (1 dc. Ch 1) 3 times in first hdc. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 
6th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 2 (does not count as st). Bobble in same sp as last sl st. (Ch 1. Bobble in next ch-1 sp) twice. *Ch 2. Skip next (dc, ch 2, sc). 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next (sc, ch 2, dc).** (Bobble in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next dc) 5 times. Bobble in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 5 times more, then from * to ** once. (Bobble in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next dc) 3 times. Join MC with sl st to top of first Bobble.
7th rnd: With MC, ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. (1 hdc in next ch-1 sp.  1 hdc in next bobble) twice. *1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. ** (1 hdc in next Bobble. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. 1 hdc in next Bobble. Rep from * 5 times more, then from * to ** once. (1 hdc in next Bobble. 1 hdc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Join C with sl st to top of first Bobble. 
Rep 2nd to 7th rnds to form pat. 
Cont in pat, changing colors in same manner in the following sequence: 
2 rnds with C. 1 rnd with MC. 
2 rnds with D. 1 rnd with MC. 
2 rnds with E. 1 rnd with MC. 
2 rnds with F. 1 rnd with MC. 
2 rnds with G. 1 rnd with MC.
2 rnds with H. 1 rnd with MC. 
2 rnds with I. 1 rnd with MC. 
2 rnds with J. 1 rnd with MC. 
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 3 balls 9925 Really Red

Yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cowl measures 15” wide x 37” circumference (38 x 94 cm).
gauge: 1 pattern repeat = 2¼” (5.5 cm) (pattern repeat consists of 4 front post double crochet and 4 back post double crochet); Rows 6–13 = 2¾” (7 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions: Ch 131 loosely. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—130 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc across, turn. Rows 3 & 4: Repeat Row 2. Row 5: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each sc across, turn—130 dc. Rows 6–9: Ch 2, *Fpdc around each of next 4 dc, Bpdc around each of next 4 dc; repeat from * across to beginning ch, dc in top of beginning ch, turn. Rows 10–13: Ch 2, *Bpdc around each of next 4 dc, Fpdc around each of next 4 dc; repeat from * across to beginning ch, dc in top of beginning ch, turn. Rows 14–45: Repeat Rows 6–13 four times. Row 46: Ch 1, sc in each dc across to beginning ch, dc in top of beginning ch, turn—130 sc. Rows 47–49: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. FINISHING: Sew short edges together to form cowl. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Colorama™ O’Go ™ (6.4 oz/180 g; 228 yds/208 m) First Blush (68009) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Splhdc = Split half double crochet: work hdc between ‘legs’ at front and back of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops. Stitches should appear as “V"s on RS and WS of work.
measurements: Approx 26" [66 cm] around x 11" [28 cm] tall.
gauge: 9 sts and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in split hdc pat.
instructions:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section for O’Go (Contrast A, B, C, D and E). You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A, B, C, D and E
• When working from chart, carry yarn not in use loosely across top of work. Work next row over strand of yarn which is not in use.
• To change color, work to last loops on hook and draw new color through last loops, then proceed in new color.
• Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
With C, ch 60 loosely. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. PM for beg of rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 2 ( does not count as st). 1 hdc in each ch around. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd.
Work Chart to end of chart, noting 4-st rep will be worked 15 times, reading rnds from right to left. 
1st rnd: 1 splhdc in each st around. Rep last rnd, until 34th rnd of Chart is complete. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Holiday”: 2 Balls 9040 Red/Silver.
Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5].
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: To Fit Bust: 32 (36, 30, 44, 48, 52)”. Finished Measurements: 16” x 36 (40, 44, 48, 52, 56)”.
gauge: 2 Shells = 4 1/2”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 44.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, * skip next 2 ch; 5 dc in next ch – shell made; skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across; turn – 7 shells.
Row 2: Ch 3, 2 dc in first sc, * skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc, skip next 2 dc **, shell in next sc; repeat from * to last sc, end at **; 3 dc in last sc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first dc, * skip next 2 dc, shell in next sc, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * across working last sc in top of ch-3; turn.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 for pattern until 36 (40, 44, 48, 52, 56)” from beginning, end by working Row 2. Fasten off.
Finishing
Lay crochet strip on a flat surface. Turn beginning ch end over to twist strip. Sew edges together while in this position. Weave in ends.
To Wear
Pull over head with twist at front and adjust top to cover shoulders as desired. OR, pull down to waist with seam at center back, then pull the front of mobius up over your head; adjust and fold back edge to form collar.

2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 2. 1 sc in top of center hdc-cl of next shell. Ch 2. 3 dc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 dc in same sp as first dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Infinity™: 3 balls 9705 Blossom
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 9mm [US M-13]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cowl measures 15” wide and 38” circumference (38 x 96.5 cm)
gauge: 1 pattern repeat = 3” (7.5 cm) (one pattern repeat consists of one shell and one single crochet); 4 rows = 2½” (6.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Ch 6. Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch count as ch-2 space), *ch 10, dc in 3rd ch from hook (skipped ch count as ch-2 space; repeat from * 4 times, do not turn—5 dc, 5 ch-2 spaces, and 31 ch. Note Dc lies horizontally above each ch-2 space; encase dc as you work into the ch-2 space. Take care not to twist Row 1 as you work. Row 2: Ch 4, sc in 2nd ch from hook, skip next 2 ch, shell in first ch-2 space, *skip next 3 ch, sc in next ch, skip next 3 ch, shell in next ch-2 space; repeat from * 3 times, skip next 2 ch, sc in last ch, turn—5 shells and 6 sc. Row 3: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), dc in first sc, *ch 2, sc in center dc of next shell, ch 2, V-st in next sc; repeat from * 3 times, ch 2, sc in center dc of last shell, ch 2, (dc, ch 1, dc) in last sc, turn—4 V-sts, 4 dc, 5 sc, 10 ch-2 sps, and 2 ch-1 spaces. Row 4: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), 4 dc in first ch-1 space, *sc in next sc, shell in ch-2 space of next V-st; repeat from * 3 times, sc in last sc, 5 dc in last ch-1 space, turn—4 shells, 10 dc, and 5 sc. Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first dc, ch 2, V-st in first sc, *ch 2, sc in center dc of next shell, ch 2, V-st in next sc; repeat from * 3 times, ch 2, sc in top of beginning ch, turn—5 V-sts, 6 sc, and 10 ch-2 spaces. Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *shell in ch-2 space of next V-st, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—5 shells and 6 sc. Rows 7–58: Repeat Rows 3–6 thirteen times. Rows 59–61: Repeat Rows 3–5 once. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. FINISHING: With right side facing, sew first and last rows together with mattress stitches. Weave in ends. Block to finished measurements if needed.

materials: RED HEART® Boulevard™: 2 balls 5505 Atrium
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 19mm [US S]

stitch marker
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cowl measures 7” (18 cm) wide x 30” (76 cm) circumference.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
COWL
Ch 14.
Row 1: Dc in 6th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first skipped ch, dc, ch 1), *ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—6 dc and 5 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 2–20: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here), *ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next dc; repeat from * across, turn.
Fasten off leaving a 24” (61 cm) tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Hold first and last rows together and whipstitch evenly to seam. Weave in ends.
Fringe
Lay piece flat so seam is visible. Counting ends of row, place stitch marker in 5th row from seam. Cut 20 lengths of yarn each measuring 14” (35.5 cm). Fold strand in half to form a loop. Insert crochet hook from front to back at marked row. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach 2nd fringe in same row. Working away from the seam, repeat to attach 2 strands in each of next 9 rows. Trim ends evenly.

5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 sts 2 rnds below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join.
6th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rnds below. Skip next dcfp 2 rnds below. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around skipped dcfp 2 rnds below. Rep from * around. Join.
8th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rnds below. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rnds below. Rep from * around. Join.
10th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
11th rnd: As 9th rnd.
12th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. 1 dcfp around first dcfp of rnd 2 rnds below. 1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rnds below. Skip next dcfp 2 rnds below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around skipped dcfp 2 rnds below. 1 dcfp around next dcfp 2 rnds below. Skip next dcfp 2 rnds below. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join.
14th rnd: Rep 3rd rnd.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *1 scbl in each of next 2 sts. 1 dcfp around each of next 2 dcfp 2 rnds below. 1 scbl in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join.
16th rnd: Rep 3rd rnd.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in first st. 1 dc in next st. *1 hdc in next st. 1 dc in next st. Rep from * around. Join.
18th rnd: Ch 1. 1 dc in first st. 1 dcfp around next st. *1 dc in next st. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.

COWL

Round 2: Slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 4, skip next dc, herr dc in next 3 dc, herr dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next dc, herr dc in next 3 dc, herr dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 3 sts, skip next dc, herr dc in last 2 dc, herr dc in join of previous round; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch.

Round 6: Slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 4, turn, skip beginning ch, herr dc in next 3 dc, herr dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next dc, herr dc in next 3 dc, herr dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 4 dc, ch 1, skip next dc, herr dc in last 3 dc; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch.

Ch 37.

2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dcbp around post of each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 dc in last st. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 dcbp around post of next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 dcbp around post of next st. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Treasure™: 4 balls 1913 Spectrum
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5 mm [US I-9]
Removable stitch markers
yarn needle
measurements: Cowl measures 58” (147.5 cm) circumference and 9” (23 cm) high.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet (sc).
instructions:
TIER 1: Base Triangles
First Triangle
Ch 2.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook—1 sc.
Row 2: Ch 2 (is not counted as a st here and throughout), turn, (hdc, sc) in the sc—2 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 sts, sc in top of turning ch—3 sc.
Row 4: Ch 2, turn, (hdc, sc) in first sc, sc in next 2 sc—4 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 4 sts, sc in top of turning ch—5 sc.
Row 6: Ch 2, turn, (hdc, sc) in first sc, sc in next 4 sc—6 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 6 sts, sc in top of turning ch—7 sc.
Row 8: Ch 2, turn, (hdc, sc) in first sc, sc in next 6 sc—8 sts.
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 8 sts, sc in top of turning ch—9 sc.
Row 10: Ch 2, turn, (hdc, sc) in first sc, sc in next 8 sc—10 sts.
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 10 sts, sc in top of turning ch and place a marker in the last sc made—11 sc.
Place a marker on right side of this triangle.

Second Triangle
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1 loosely, do not turn, sc in end of last row of previous triangle—1 sc.
Rows 2–11: Work same as Rows 2–11 of First Triangle.
Place a marker on right side of this triangle. Notes: Placing a marker on the right side of each triangle helps prevent accidentally twisting the row of triangles. It is normal for this piece to curl as it is crocheted.

Prepare for Second Tier: Ch 1 loosely, do not turn, sc in edge of Row 11—1 sc.

TIER 2: Edge Triangles and Center Block
Beginning Edge Triangle
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, turn, sc2tog over first sc and the marked sc of the previous shape, remove the marker, slip st in next st—1 sc.
Row 2: Turn, skip the slip st, (sc, hdc) in next sc—2 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc2tog over next sc and next sc of previous shape, slip st in next st—3 sc.
Row 4: Turn, skip the slip st, sc in next 2 sc, (sc, hdc) in next sc—4 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog over next sc and next sc of previous shape, slip st in next st—5 sc.
Row 6: Turn, skip the slip st, sc in next 4 sc, (sc, hdc) in next sc—6 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog over next sc and next sc of previous shape, slip st in next st—7 sc.
Row 8: Turn, skip the slip st, sc in next 6 sc, (sc, hdc) in next sc—8 sts.
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog over next sc and next sc of previous shape, slip st in next st—9 sc.
Row 10: Turn, skip the slip st, sc in next 8 sc, (sc, hdc) in next sc—10 sts.
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 8 sts, sc2tog over next sc and next sc of previous shape, place a marker in the sc2tog just made—11 sc.

Center Block
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1 loosely, do not turn, sc in end of first 10 rows of next side edge of previous tier, sc2tog over end of last row and the marked sc of the next shape, remove marker, slip st in next st—11 sc.
Row 2: Turn, skip the slip st, sc in next 11 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 10 sc, sc2tog over next sc and next sc of previous tier, slip st in next st.
Rows 4–9: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 three times.
Row 10: Repeat Row 2.
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 10 sc, sc2tog over next sc and next sc of previous shape, place a maker in sc2tog just made.

End Edge Triangle
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1 loosely, do not turn, sc in end of each of the 11 rows of next side edge of previous tier—11 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, sc in next 10 sc—10 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 8 sc, skip next sc, hdc in last sc—9 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 8 sts—8 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 6 sc, skip next sc, hdc in last sc—7 sts.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 6 sts—6 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 4 sc, skip next sc, hdc in last sc—5 sts.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 4 sts—4 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 sc, skip next sc, hdc in last sc—3 sts.
Row 10: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 2 sts—2 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, skip first sc, hdc in last sc—1 st.

TIER 3: Two Blocks
First Block
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1 loosely, TURN, sc in end of first 10 rows of previous shape, sc2tog over end of next row and marked sc of next shape, remove marker, slip st in next st—11 sc.
Row 2: Turn, skip the slip st, sc in next 11 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 10 sc, sc2tog over next sc and next sc of previous tier, slip st in next st.
Rows 4–9: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 three times.
Row 10: Repeat Row 2.
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 10 sc, sc2tog over next sc and next sc of previous shape, place a maker in sc2tog just made.

Second Block
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1 loosely, do not turn, sc in end of first 10 rows of next side edge of previous tier, sc2tog over end of next row and marked sc of next shape, remove marker, slip st in next st—11 sc.
Rows 2–10: Work same as Rows 2–10 of First Block.
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across, place a marker in last sc just made, sc in last st of previous tier—12 sc.

NEXT TIERS
Repeat Tiers 2 and 3 eleven more times.
Repeat Tier 2 once more.
Notes: If desired, repeat Tiers 2 and 3 more or fewer times for a longer or shorter cowl. This will also alter the amount of yarn needed.

LAST TIER: Top Triangles
First Triangle
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1 loosely, TURN, sc in end of first 10 rows of previous shape, sc2tog over end of next row and marked sc of next shape of previous tier, remove marker, slip st in next st of previous tier—11 sc.
Row 2: Turn, sc in first 9 sc, skip next st, hdc in last sc—10 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 8 sts, sc2tog over next st and next st in previous tier, slip st in next st of previous tier—9 sc.
Row 4: Turn, skip the slip st, sc in next 7 sc, skip next sc, hdc in last sc—8 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog over next st and next st in previous tier, slip st in next st of previous tier—7 sc.
Row 6: Turn, skip the slip st, sc in next 5 sc, skip next sc, hdc in last sc—6 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog over next st and next st in previous tier, slip st in next st of previous tier—5 sc.
Row 8: Turn, skip the slip st, sc in next 3 sc, skip next sc, hdc in last sc—4 sts.
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog over next st and next st in previous tier, slip st in next st of previous tier—3 sc.
Row 10: Turn, skip the slip st, sc in next sc, skip next sc, hdc in last sc—2 sts.
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc2tog over last sc and next sc of previous tier—1 st.

Second Triangle
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1 loosely, do not turn, sc in end of first 10 rows of next side edge of previous tier, sc2tog over end of next row and marked sc of next shape of previous tier, remove marker, slip st in next st of previous tier—11 sc.
Rows 2–10: Work same as Rows 2–10 of First Triangle—2 sts.
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc2tog over last sc and last sc of previous tier—1 st.

FINISHING
You now have a rectangle of crochet Entrelac fabric. The rectangle may feel a little stiff but the fabric will loosen and become MUCH more pliable once it has been washed and blocked. Accordingly, the designer recommends that you weave in the ends and block the cowl BEFORE working the border.

Border
Join yarn with slip st at end of one long edge, ch 1, work reverse single crochet evenly spaced across the long edge. Fasten off. Repeat across the other long edge. Sew the short edges of the rectangle together to form cowl.

COWL
Ch 30.

Twist 1 short end of piece once and seam short ends together to form tube with single twist.

Edging
Round 1: Working in ends of rows, join with sc in first row nearest seam, shell in same row, *skip next row, (sc, shell) in next row; repeat from * around to last row, skip last row; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

measurements: Cowl is approximately 7” (18cm) wide x 40” (101.6 cm) circumference.
gauge: Gauge is not important.
instructions:
Beginning chain: Working with one strand of each of the four yarns, use your fingers to make a slip knot and adjust loop so that two fingers will fit into it. Use your fingers to pull yarn strands from balls through the loop; 1 chain made. Repeat 6 more times so you have 7 chains (photo A).
Row 1: With last chain on your fingers, slip fingers into second chain from your hand and pull working yarn through; you now have two loops on your fingers. Then pull yarn through both loops; 1 single crochet (sc) made. Repeat in each of the remaining 5 chains to finish first row of 6 single crochets (photo B).
Row 2: Chain 1 and turn. Slip your fingers under the top strands of the first sc, pull working strands through (you now have 2 loops of yarn strands on your fingers). Pull working yarn through both loops; 1 sc made. Repeat in remaining 5 sc (photo C).
Repeat Row 2 until 40” (1m) long or desired length.
Joining with Slip Stitches: Holding beginning chain under last row, slip fingers through both last stitch and chain st; pull a loop of yarn through. Leaving loop on your fingers, continue across to join the last row to the beginning chains. Cut tail about 10” long and pull through loop still on your fingers; pull tightly to secure.
FINISHING: Weave tail through existing stitches.
