materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1701 Hot Pink
Susan Bates® Luxite Crochet Hooks: 8mm [US L-11] and 6mm [US J-10] (for aid when working cables only)
Yarn needle
measurements: Cowl measures 8” [20.5 cm] wide x 40” [101.5 cm] long
gauge: 20 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 14 rows = 4” [10 cm] in pattern using larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
1. Cowl is crocheted, using special patterns of slip stitches that create a knit-like appearance. The piece is worked back and forth in rows then short edges are sewn together to form a circle.
2. Written instructions are provided for the first 3 rows of the chart, then the Cowl is completed by reading all remaining rows from the chart.
3. The larger hook is used to make all stitches. The smaller hook serves as a cable needle when working cables.
4. Designer recommends using Susan Bates® Luxite hooks for this project. They are extremely light weight so when used for a cable needle they do not pull the yarn out of shape. Susan Bates® Luxite hooks have a sharper point on the head and also a sharper hook than some crochet hooks. If the stitches get a little tight (which they sometimes do with this type of stitch) one can insert the sharper hook through the stitch if needed. Always try to keep these stitches loose.
5. When working cables, the Cowl will be pulled in making the width smaller. Work at least 4” [10 cm] of Cowl before measuring for width.

COWL
With larger hook, ch 40.
Row 1 (right side): Working in back bars only, knit in first ch (do not skip first ch) and in next 2 ch, purl in next ch, knit in next 6 ch, purl in next ch, knit in next ch, purl in next ch, knit in next 3 ch, purl in next ch, knit in next 6 ch, purl in next ch, knit in next 3 ch, purl in next ch, knit in next ch, purl in next ch, knit in next 6 ch, purl in next ch, knit in last 3 ch, turn work counterclockwise (yarn end will be in front of work)—40 sts (Row 1 of chart completed).
Row 2 (wrong side): Pass yarn end to back of work going between loop on hook and first st. Working in back loops only, knit in first 4 sts, purl in next 6 sts, knit in next st, purl in next st, knit in next st, purl in next 3 sts, knit in next 8 sts, purl in next 3 sts, knit in next st, purl in next st, knit in next st, purl in next 6 sts, knit in last 4 sts, turn work counterclockwise (yarn end will be in front of work). (Row 2 of chart completed).
Row 3: Pass yarn end to back of work going around outside edge of work to back of work. Working in front loops only, knit in first 3 sts, purl in next st, 3FK3KC, purl in next st, knit in next st, purl in next st, 3FP1KC, purl in next st, knit in next 4 sts, purl in next st, 1BK3PC, purl in next st, knit in next st, purl in next st, 3FK3KC, purl in next st, knit in last 3 sts, turn work counterclockwise (yarn end will be in front of work). (Row 3 of chart completed).
Continue following chart, working Rows 1-28 a total of 5 times.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING
Using long yarn tail, sew first and last rows together to form piece into a circle. Weave in ends.

abbreviations: Dc5tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next chain or stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.

instructions:
Notes: 
• For striping effect shown, work with 2 cakes throughout. Use yarn from one cake for color A, and yarn from second cake for color B. 
• Begin using each cake at different points in color transition to ensure contrasting colors. In most cases, this is achieved by working from the exterior of first cake and from interior of second. If necessary to ensure color contrast, wind off and remove access of one colour and set aside for future use. 
• Carry color not in use loosely up side of work

With A, ch 40. 
1st row:  2 dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch-3 counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Dc5tog. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. *5 dc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Dc5tog. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to last ch. 3 dc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 scfp around each dc to last st. 1 sc in top of ch-3. Join B. Turn.
3rd row:  With B, ch 3. 2 dc in first sc. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Dc5tog. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. *5 dc in next st. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Dc5tog. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last st. 3 dc in last sc. Turn. 
4th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. 1 scbp around each dc to last st. 1 sc in top of ch-3. Join A. Turn.
5th row:  With A, as 3rd row. 
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 60" [152.5 cm], ending on 4th row.
Fasten off. 
Sew foundation ch and last row together to form loop. 
Side edging:  
Note:  Work around yarn carried up side from color changes when working edging. 
Join yarn with sl st to side edge of Cowl at seam. 
1st rnd:  Ch 1. Work sc evenly around side edge of Cowl.  Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Rep for opposite side edge of Cowl.

materials: Red Heart® “Shimmer”: 2 balls 1929 Red
Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Circumference at bottom edge above border: 35”; Circumference at top edge below border: 24”
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 13 rounds = 4” in pattern stitch (see below). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Special Stitches
fsc (foundation single crochet) = Ch 2, insert hook in 2nd chain from hook and draw up a loop (ch stitch made) * yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook (sc made), insert hook in ch stitch and draw up a loop; repeat from * for as many fsc as called for in pattern.
sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next sc] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

NOtE: Bottom border is worked back and forth first, then stitches are picked up from the foundation and worked in the round to the neck.

Pattern Stitch (worked in the round on a multiple of 2 sts)
To make gauge swatch, ch 22, join with slip st to first ch.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in first ch, *ch 1, skip 1 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * around—12 sc.
Rounds 2-13: Sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip ch-1 space, sc in next sc; repeat from * around. Piece should measure 6¼” around and 4” tall.

COWL
Leaving a long tail for seaming, fsc 127; turn.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, dc in first fsc, *ch 1, skip 1 fsc, dc in next fsc; repeat from * across; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *sc in next ch-space, ch 4, skip next 2 chain spaces, [2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc] in next chain space, ch 4, skip next 2 ch-spaces, sc in next ch-space and in next dc; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in next sc, *sc in ch-4 space, *ch 3, skip 2 dc, [3 dc, ch 4, 3 dc] in ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-4 space, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * across, omitting last sc; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, *ch 4, skip [sc, ch 3, 3 dc], [dc, (ch 1, dc) 6 times] in ch-4 space, ch 4, skip [3 dc, ch 3, sc], sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * across, omitting last sc; turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 4, skip [ch-4 space, 1 dc] [sc, ch 2] in each of next 5 ch-1 spaces, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 4, skip [1 dc, ch-4 space, 1 sc], sc in next sc; repeat from * across. Fasten off.

With right side facing and holding border so that the fsc row is on top, rejoin yarn in third chain space of the foundation row.
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first fsc, ch 1, *skip 1 fsc, sc in next fsc, ch 1; repeat from * across, leaving last 2 fsc unworked—62 sc. Being careful not to twist, join in the round with a slip stitch to first sc. Place marker to designate first stitch.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 1, skip ch-1 space, sc in next sc; repeat from * around. Move marker up as you work in same sc. Repeat Round 1 for 38 more rounds.

Decrease Rounds
Round 40: Sc in first sc, ch 1, sc in next sc, *ch 1, sc2tog, [ch 1, sc in next sc] 3 times; repeat from * around—50 sc.
Round 41: Work even.
Round 42: Sc in first sc of round, ch 1, sc in next sc, *ch 1, sc2tog, [ch 1, sc in next sc] 4 times; repeat from * around—42 sc.

Edging
Round 43: Ch 1, sc in marked sc, *skip 2 ch-spaces, ch 2, [dc, (ch 1, dc) 6 times] in next ch-space, ch 2, skip next 2 ch-spaces, sc in next ch-space, sc in next sc and in next ch-space; repeat from * around.
Round 44: *Ch 2, [sc, ch 2] in each of the next 6 ch-1 spaces of shell, skip 1 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, ending with slip stitch in center sc. Fasten off. Sew seam. Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each of 451 Parakeet A, 431 Pumpkin B, 332 Hot Pink C, and 421 Goldenrod D.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 1.40mm [US 8]
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cowl measures 60” (152.5 cm) around and 7” (18) cm tall.
gauge: 2 “ripples” = 4” (10 cm) measured from peak to peak; 19 rows = 4” (10 cm) in ripple pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
COWL
With A, ch 480. Being careful not to twist chain, join with slip st in first ch.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in same ch as joining, [ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch] twice, ch 1, skip next ch, dc5tog, *[ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch] twice, ch 1, skip next ch, 5 dc in next ch, [ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch] twice, ch 1, skip next ch, dc5tog; repeat from * around to last 5 ch, [ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch] twice, ch 1, skip last ch, 2 dc in same ch as joining; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—30 “ripples”.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in each dc and ch around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off A.

Fasten off B.
Repeat Rounds 3 and 4 working 2 rounds each in the following color sequence: C, D, A, *B, C, D, and A; repeat from * until piece measures about 7” (18 cm) from beginning.

Edging
With right side of Cowl facing and working across the opposite side of the foundation ch, join B with slip st in the ch at base of first 5-dc group, ch 1 sc in each ch around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

Special Stitch
dc5tog (double crochet 5 stitches together) = [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 5 times, yarn over, draw through all 6 loops on hook.

Notes
1. Cowl is worked in joined rounds with right side always facing. Do not turn at the beginning of rounds.
2. The cowl is worked in a lacy ripple pattern of 5-dc “peaks” and dc5tog “valleys”. The peaks of each row are worked into the center dc of the 5-dc peaks of the previous row, and the valleys are worked centered over the dc5tog valleys of the previous row.
3. The Cowl can be worked by reading the written instructions or stitch diagram.

materials: Bernat® Mega Bulky™(10.5 oz/300 g; 64 yds/58 m) Teal (88206) 1 ball
Size U.S. S (19 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: V-st = (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in indicated stitch.
measurements: Approx 28" [71 cm] around x 10" [25.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 4 dc and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: There is no RS or WS.
Ch 12.
1st row: V-st in 4th ch from hook (counts as hdc and V-st). *Skip next 2 ch. V-st in next ch. Rep from * once more. Skip next ch. 1 hdc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). (V-st in ch-1 sp of next V-st) 3 times. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 28" [71 cm]. Fasten off.
Sew 1st row and last row tog to form loop.

materials: RED HEART® Grande™: 6 balls
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 16 mm [US Q]
Large eye yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cowl measures 24” wide x 56” circumference (61 x 142 cm).
gauge: 4 sc = 3¾” (9.5 cm); 4 rows = 3½” (9 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 61.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 3, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, ch 3, skip last 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc— 20 sc and 20 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 1, 3 sc in same space and in each ch-3 space around; join with slip st in first sc— 60 sc.
Rounds 4–27: Repeat Rounds 2 and 3 twelve times.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: 2 skeins 3949 Reef of RED HEART® Super Saver®
5.5mm [US I-9] Susan Bates® Crochet Hook
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cowl measures 9" (23 cm) wide and 67" (170 cm) long before seaming.
gauge: 12 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern.
instructions:
COWL  
Ch 31.
Row 1 (Right Side): Dc in 3rd ch from hook [counts as (sc, dc)], *skip 1 ch, (sc, dc) in next ch; repeat from * to last 2 chs, skip 1 ch, sc in last ch, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, dc in first sc [counts as (sc, dc)], *skip next dc, (sc, dc) in next sc; repeat from * to last 2 sts, skip next dc, sc in last sc, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 67" (170 cm) from foundation edge.
Do not fasten off.
Join Short Ends
Lay piece flat. Twist one short end to create a “mobius” twist, then bring two short ends together. Using working yarn, slip st across the short ends to secure the twist. Fasten off.
FINISHING 
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m)
Peach Blush Parfait (01011) 2 braids
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 33" [84 cm] around x 12" [30.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 14 sts and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes:
• Before working with  Caron® x Pantone™ multi-
shade yarn braid, separate each color link and wind into 5 separate balls for each braid.
• Each color link will be referenced by its Pantone™ color # (see label).
• Designate each yarn ball Contrast, A, B, C, D and E as noted in Materials section (or as desired).
• Due to finite amount of yarn in each shade, pattern gauge must be matched to ensure successful results
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.
Front and Back (make 2 pieces alike)
First Block
With A, ch 31.
1st row: (WS). 1 dc in 5th ch from hook (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc). *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 dc in next ch. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 29 sts.
2nd to 10th rows: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). Skip first ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. Join B at end of 10th row.
11th to 20th rows: With B, rep 2nd row 10 times more. Fasten off.
Second Block
Turn work 90 degrees clockwise. Join C with sl st to top right corner of work (beg ch).
1st row: (RS). Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). Work (1 dc. Ch 1) 17 times evenly across side of First Block. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 37 sts.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). Skip first ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row 4 times more. Fasten off.
Third Block
1st row: (WS). Join D with sl st to top right corner of work (First Block). Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). Work (1 dc. Ch 1) 19 times evenly across side of First and Second Blocks. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) all in corner. *Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 42 sts on first side, 38 sts on second side and 1 corner ch-2 sp.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). Skip first ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to corner ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) all in corner ch-2 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Rep 2nd row. Fasten off.
Fourth Block
Turn work clockwise 90 degrees. 1st row: (WS). Join E with sl st to top right corner of work (1st Block). Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). Work (1 dc. Ch 1) 20 times evenly across side of Block. 1 dc in corner. Turn. 43 sts.
2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as 1 dc. Ch 1). Skip first ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. *Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd to 5th rows: Rep 2nd row 3 times more. Fasten off.
Sew side seams of Front and Back tog.

materials: RED HEART® Stellar™: 2 balls of 9620 Quark
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 9mm [US M-13]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st.
measurements: Cowl measures 6” wide x 68” (173 cm) in circumference (15 x 152.5 cm).
gauge: 2 shells = 4” (10 cm); 5 rows = 5” (12.5 cm) CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COWL
Ch 18.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc), skip next 3 ch, shell in next ch, skip next 5 ch, shell in next ch, skip next 3 ch, 2 dc in last ch, turn – 12 dc and 2 ch-3 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first dc, shell in each of next 2 ch-3 spaces, 2 dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 68” (173 cm). Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Matching sts across last row and foundation ch, sew short ends together to form cowl. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 4601 Off White
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Scarf measures 8” x 40” (20.5 x 101.5 cm)
gauge: 6 shells and 2 double crochet = 8” (20.5 cm); 3 rows = 2” (5 cm) in pattern. 3 rows for gauge measurement consist of 2 repeats of Row 3 with one Row 2 between. Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Ch 34.
Row 1 (right side): Shell in 6th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc, ch 2), *skip next 4 ch, shell in next ch; repeat from * to last 3 ch, skip next 2 ch, dc in last ch, turn—6 shells and 2 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first dc, ch 5, skip next shell, sc in space between shell just skipped and next shell, *ch 5, sc in space between next 2 shells; repeat from * to last shell, ch 5, skip last shell, sc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn—7 sc and 6 ch-5 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), skip first sc and first 2 ch, *shell in next ch, skip next 2 ch, skip next sc, skip next 2 ch; repeat from * 5 times, skip last 2 ch, dc in last sc, turn—6 shells and 2 dc.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until cowl measures 39” (99 cm).
Last Row (wrong side): Ch 3, (dc in first dc, hdc in next dc, sc in next dc, hdc in next dc, dc in last dc) in each shell, dc in top of beginning ch, turn. Do not fasten off.
FINISHING
With right sides of short ends held together and working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Treasure™: 2 balls 1919 Watercolors
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5 mm [US K-10½]
Yarn needle
measurements: Cowl measures 26” (66 cm) circumference at widest, 22” (56 cm) circumference around neck, and 10” (25 cm) high.
gauge: 17 sts = 4” (10 cm); 9 rows = 4” (10 cm) in half double crochet (hdc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 33.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—32 hdc.
Row 2 (right side): Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, hdc in each st across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, hdc in each st across.
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 until you have worked a total of 60 rows.
Seaming Row (wrong side): Turn, hold first and last rows with right sides together and stitches matching, working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across to join piece into a circle. Do not fasten off.
Turn piece so that right side is facing out.
Edging (right side): Ch 1, work 2 sc in the end of every other row all the way around; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc. Fasten off.
With right side facing, draw up a loop of yarn in seam on opposite edge of cowl and repeat Edging.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: 1 ball each of 572 Orchid A, 703 Pink B
1 ball 935 Party Print C
1 ball 9935 Party D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 11.5 mm [US P-16]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cowl measures 30” (76 cm) circumference and 7½” (19 cm) high.
gauge: 7 sts = 4” (10 cm); 4 rows = 4” (10 cm). EXACT GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL.
instructions:
With A, ch 14.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, [ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 6 times—7 sc and 6 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, sc in first sc, [ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next sc] 6 times. Fasten off.
Row 5 (right side): With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in first sc of previous row, ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in same sc, [ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next sc] 6 times.
Rows 6-8: With C, repeat Rows 2-4. Fasten off.
Rows 9-32: Repeat Rows 5-8, changing color as in the following sequence: Work next 4 rows with B, 4 rows with D, 4 rows with A, 4 rows with C, 4 rows with B, and 4 rows with D.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING: Sew the short edges together. Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Bone (39703) 1 ball
Contrast B Burgundy (39762) 1 ball
Contrast C Red (39729) 1 ball
Contrast D Fuchsia (39764) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) flexible cable Tunisian crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) standard crochet hook for edging.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] deep x 25" [63.5 cm] around.
gauge: 16 sts and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Tunisian Knit St pat.
instructions:
Note: Work all rows with RS of work facing.
With A and Tunisian hook, ch 105. 
Note: Work into horizontal bumps at back of foundation chain for 1st row. 
1st row: Forward pass (Right to Left): 
Insert hook into 2nd ch from hook. Yoh, draw loop through and leave on hook. 
*Insert hook in next ch. Yoh, draw loop through and leave on hook. Rep from * to end of chain. Do not turn. 105 sts on hook.
Return pass (Left to right): Yoh and draw through first loop on hook for selvedge st. *Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Rep from * until 1 loop rem on hook. Do not turn. Loop rem on hook becomes first st of next row.
**2nd row: Forward pass (Right to Left): Skip first st (directly below loop on hook). *Insert hook from front to back into next stitch below chains formed by previous row. Yoh, draw loop through and leave on hook - Tks made. Rep from * across, working last st through 2 loops at edge. Do not turn.
Return pass (Left to Right): Work as Return Pass for 1st row.**
Rep from ** to ** for Tunisian knit st (Tks) Pat once more.
Note: Carry colors when not in use loosely across WS of work. 
Chart shows first st (loop on hook after return pass) and last st.
Color ‘set-up’ does not change during return pass rows.
At end of return pass note to change color by drawing through last 2 loops on hook to proceed with new color in following row.
Place chart: Next row: Forward pass (Right to left): Skip first st (directly below loop on hook). Work 3 more Tks. *With B, work 1 Tks. With A, work 3 Tks. Rep from * to last st. With A, work last Tks. Do not turn.
Return pass (Left to Right): With A, yoh and draw through first loop on hook for selvedge st. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. *With B, yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. With A, (yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Rep from * across, ending with A, yoh and draw through last 2 loops at edge. Do not turn.
Row 1 of Chart is complete.
Cont working rem of Chart in Tks Pat, noting 4-st rep will be worked 25 times. 
Fasten off.
Sew sides tog to form Cowl.
Bottom edging: 1st rnd: (RS). With size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook, join B with sl st at top of seam edge. Ch 1. Work 104 sc evenly around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Working in back loops only, 1 dc each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
Fasten off.
Fold edging towards WS and sew in position.
Top edging: With A, work as for Top edging.

materials: Red Heart® Boutique Unforgettable®: 1 ball 3932 Springtime
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cowl measures 9½” wide x 30” circumference (24 x 76 cm)
gauge: 2 pattern repeats = 4” (10 cm) (one pattern repeat consists of one shell and one single crochet); 8 rows = 4” (10 cm). Use any size to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COWL
Ch 92.
Foundation Row: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—91 sc.

First Side
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in first sc, *bobble in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—45 bobbles and 46 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn—91 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *skip next 2 sc, shell in next sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—15 shells and 16 sc.
Row 4: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in first sc, *sc in center dc of next shell, shell in next sc; repeat from * across to last shell, sc in center dc of last shell, 3 dc in last sc, turn—14 shells, 15 sc, and 3 dc at each end.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first dc, shell in next sc, *sc in center dc of next shell, shell in next sc; repeat from * across to last 3 dc, skip next 2 dc, sc in last dc, turn—15 shells and 16 sc.
Rows 6–11: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 three times. Fasten off.

Second Side
Row 1 (wrong side): With wrong side of Foundation Row facing and working in opposite side of foundation ch, join yarn with sc in first ch, *skip next 2 ch, shell in next ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—15 shells and 16 sc.
Rows 2–9: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 of first side 4 times.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING
Working across ends of rows, sew short edges together. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby™  (140 g/5 oz; 331 m/362 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G/6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4 buttons.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] wide x 20" [51 cm] long.
gauge: 16 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With A, ch 77.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. *Miss next 3 ch. 
7 dc in next ch. Miss next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Rep from * to 
last 4 ch. Miss next 3 ch. 4 dc in last ch. Join B. Turn.
2nd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 dc. *Ch 3. (Yoh and draw 
up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 7 times. Yoh 
and draw through all 8 loops on hook – cluster made. Ch 3. 1 sc in each 
of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. 
Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times. Yoh and draw through all 
loops on hook – dc4tog made. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in first st. *Miss next ch-3. 1 sc in each 
of next 3 sc. Miss next ch-3. 7 dc in top of next cluster. Rep from * across, 
ending with 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join A. Turn.
4th row: With A, ch 2. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw 
through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – 
beg dc4tog made. *Ch 3. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 3. Cluster. Rep from 
* across, ending with 1 sc in next dc. 1 sc in top of ch-3. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *Miss next ch-3. 7 dc in next 
cluster. Miss next ch-3. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last ch -3. 
Miss last ch-3. 4 dc in last st. Join B. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows twice more. Fasten off.
Lower edging: With RS facing, join A with sl st to first ch of foundation ch. 
Working in rem loops of foundation ch, ch 3 (counts as dc). 3 dc in same 
sp as last sl st. *Miss next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Miss next 3 ch. 
7 dc in next ch. Rep from * across, ending with 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 
Fasten off.
Buttonhole Band edging: **1st row: (RS). Join B with sl st to bottom 
right corner. Ch 1. Work 24 sc evenly along side edge. Turn.**
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Ch 2. Miss next 2 sc (buttonhole 
made). 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * twice more. Ch 2. Miss next 
2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch to end of row. Fasten off.
Button Band edging: Rep from ** to ** on opposite side edge.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off  
at end of 3rd row.
Sew buttons to correspond to buttonholes.

materials: Red Heart® Grande™: 1 ball 511 Wintergreen
Crochet Hook: Your fingers
measurements: Cowl is approximately 7½” (19cm) wide x 29” (74cm) circumference.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
Beginning chain: Use your fingers to make a slip knot and adjust loop so that two fingers will fit into it easily. Use your fingers to pull yarn strands from balls through the loop; 1 chain made. Repeat 6 more times so you have 7 chains (photo A).
Row 1: With last chain on your fingers, slip fingers into second chain from your hand and pull working yarn through; you now have two loops on your fingers. Then pull yarn through both loops; 1 single crochet (sc) made (photo B). Repeat in each of the remaining 5 chains to finish first row of 6 single crochets (photo C).
Row 2: Chain 1 and turn. Slip your fingers under the top strands of the first sc, pull working strand through (you now have 2 loops of yarn strands on your fingers). Pull working yarn through both loops; 1 sc made. Repeat in remaining 5 sc (photo D).
Repeat Row 2 until 28” (1m) long leaving enough length for joining.
Joining with Slip Stitches: Holding beginning chain under last row, slip fingers through both last stitch and chain st; pull a loop of yarn through. Leaving loop on your fingers, continue across to join the last row to the beginning chains. Cut tail about 10” (25 cm) long and pull through loop still on your fingers; pull tightly to secure.
FINISHING: Weave ends through existing stitches.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver: 1 skein each 528 Medium Purple A and 3950 Charcoal B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cowl measures 9" long x 60" in circumference (23 x 152.5 cm).
gauge: 11 sts = 4" (10 cm) in herringbone double crochet and chain-1; 7 rows = 4" (10 cm) in herringbone double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
COWL
With A, ch 180; taking care not to twist, join with slip st in first ch.
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as first herr dc and ch-1 space here and throughout), skip next ch, herr dc in next 4 ch, *ch 1, skip next ch, herr dc in next 4 ch; repeat from * around to last 4 ch, ch 1, skip next ch, herr dc in last 3 ch; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch—144 herr dc and 36 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 4, skip next dc, herr dc in next 3 dc, herr dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next dc, herr dc in next 3 dc, herr dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 3 sts, skip next dc, herr dc in last 2 dc, herr dc in join of previous round; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch.
Rounds 3 and 4: Repeat Round 2; change to B at end of Round 4.
Round 5: Slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 4, turn, skip beginning ch, herr dc in next 3 dc, herr dc in next ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next dc, herr dc in next 3 dc, herr dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to last 4 dc, ch 1, skip next dc, herr dc in last 3 dc; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch.
Rounds 6–8: Repeat Round 2; change to A at end of Round 8.
Rounds 9–12: Repeat Rounds 5-8; changing to B at end of Round 12. 
Rounds 13–16: Repeat Rounds 5-8. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Brushed™ (5 oz/141 g; 253 yds/231 m) Dusty Pink (5071) 2 balls or 370 yds/338 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
Stitch marker.
Safety pin.
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
measurements: Approx 28" [71 cm] around x 20" [51 cm] deep.
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as hdc.

COWL
Ch 23.
Foundation row:  (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 21 sts.
1st row:  (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdcbl in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures approx 28" [71 cm], ending on a WS row. Do not break yarn.
Fold in half and working through both thicknesses join last row to foundation row, *work 1 sl st through back loop only of last row and coordinating rem loop of foundation row. Rep from * across. Fasten off.

HOOD
Notes:
• Position Cowl sl st join as center back. Fold in half along join to determine center front. PM to mark center front.
• Ch-1 counts as st.

CROCHET I  SKILL LEVEL: EASY

FRONT BACK
Ch 3, leaving a 35" [89 cm] long end for seaming Drawstring Casing later.
Joining row:  (RS). Beg at center front of Cowl, sl st 84 sts evenly around to other side of center front. Ch 5. Turn.
Next row:  (WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next sl st (working under both loops). Ch 1. Skip next sl st – Drawstring Hole made. 1 hdc in each sl st to last 5 sts (includes  2 sl sts and 3 ch). Ch 1. Skip next sl st – Drawstring Hole made. 1 hdc in next sl st. 1 hdc in each of last 3 ch. Turn. 88 hdc and 2 ch-1 sps.
Next row:  (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdcbl in each st to end of row. 90 hdc.
Rep last row until work from sl st row measures approx 13" [33 cm], ending on a RS row. Do not fasten off.
Fold in half (WS tog) and work through both thicknesses to join first 45 sts to last 45 sts, working  1 sl st in each pair of inner loops to end of row. Fasten off.

Drawstring
Ch 161.
1st row: (RS). Working into horizontal “bump" at back of each ch, 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. 160 sts.

FINISHING
Drawstring Casing: Turn first 3 sts and last 3 sts of Hood portion to WS (inside) and whipstitch into place. Pin safety pin to one end of Drawstring. Work Drawstring through Casing. Remove safety pin.

instructions:
Granny Square Motif (make 8) 
Notes: Instructions which appear in brackets ( ) 
should be treated as a group. 
Right side (RS) of work is facing when working 
rounds.
With A, chain (ch) 4. Join with slip stitch (sl st) in first 
chain to form a ring.
1st round: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 double crochet (dc) 
in ring. (Ch 3. 3 dc) 3 times in ring. Ch 3. Join with sl st 
to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
2nd round: Join B with sl st in any ch-3 space (sp).  
Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as 
last sl st. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp - 
corner. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. Join with sl st to 
top of beginning (beg) ch 3. Fasten off. 
3rd round: Join C with sl st to any corner ch-3 sp. 
Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp 
as last sl st. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc.  
Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more.  
Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of  
ch 3. Fasten off.
4th round: Join D with sl st  in any corner ch-3 sp.  
Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as 
last sl st. *(Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1.  
(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice 
more. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Join 
with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
5th round: Join E with sl st in any corner ch-3 sp.  
Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp.

Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. 
(Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. Join with  
sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.

Granny Square Motifs together with RS facing into a

together to form Cowl.

materials: RED HEART® Shimmer®: 2 balls each of 1536 Purple A and 1931 Purple Haze B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: SFPhdc = Standing Front Post half double crochet
measurements: Cowl measures 6” (15 cm) wide x 50” (127 cm) on circumference.
gauge: 14 sts and 10 rows = 4” (10 cm) in hdc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Round 1: Work 180 Fhdc, slip st to top of first Fhdc to form a ring, being careful not to twist foundation – 180 sts. Fasten off.
Round 2: Turn, choose a place to start this round where there are no other rounds started, SFPhdc in any st in previous round, FPhdc in each sts around; join with a slip st in top of beg SFPhdc – 180 sts. Fasten off.
Rounds 3-30: Maintaining color sequence as established, repeat Round 2. Fasten off.
FINISHING: With sewing length, sew base of first Fhdc of Round 1. Weave in ends.
NOTE: Each round is fastened off as it is completed, and then the piece is turned so you are working from the other side, and the next round is started at any point. This will create a staggered starting point for each round so there is no visible seam on your finished cowl.
Color Sequence: Work in the following color sequence throughout: *1 row A; 1 row B; repeat from * throughout.
Special Abbreviations: Foundation half double crochet (Fhdc): Leaving a sewing length, ch 3, yarn over, insert hook in 3rd chain from hook, yarn over and pull up loop (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through 1 loop on hook (chain made), yarn over and draw through all loops on hook (1 Fhdc made), *yarn over, insert hook under the 2 loops of the “chain” stitch of last stitch and pull up loop, yarn over and draw through 1 loop on hook (chain made), yarn over and draw through all loops on hook (next Fhdc made); repeat from * to for desired number of Fhdc.
Front Post half double crochet (FPhdc): Yarn over, insert hook from front to back to front again around the post of the hdc in the row below, yarn over and draw through (3 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through all loops.
Standing Front Post half double crochet (SFPhdc): This stitch is used to start a round with a new strand of yarn, without having to use a starting chain. Make a slip knot in yarn and place the loop over the hook, yarn over, insert hook from front to back to front again.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Yarn®: 1 ball 9870 Deep Sea

gauge: 2 sc = 1” (2.5 cm); 2 rows = 1” (2.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT/NECK WARMER
Row 1: With larger hook, ch 30, sc in 5th ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—26 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st across, turn—26 sc.
Row 3: Ch 4, working in back loops only, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 4–39: Repeat rows 2–3 18 times.
Row 40: Ch 1, working through both loops of row 39 sts and unused loops of foundation ch at same time, slip st in each st across, fasten off. Turn piece so seam is on inside.
Tie
Step 1: With smaller hook, ch 3, join with slip st in first ch to form ring, ch 3, 11 dc in ring, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Do not fasten off.
Step 2: Ch 80, slip st in 4th ch from hook to form ring.
Step 3: Ch 3, 11 dc in ring, join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3, fasten off.
Assembly
Keeping seam to back of work, weave tie through ch-4 loops.
Hat
Pull ends of Tie to draw ch-4 loops together. Tie ends in a bow to form top of Hat. Fold up lower edge to form a cuff if desired.
Neck Warmer
Loosen tie completely. Pull neck warmer over head and shape as desired around neck.

measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] deep x 60" [152.5 cm] around.
gauge: 8 sts (3 dc, Ch 4, 1 tr) and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of round counts as dc.
Ch 160. Join with st in first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st in first sc. 160 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 4. 1 tr) in same sp as sl st. Skip next 3 sc. *(3 dc. Ch 4. 1 tr) in next sc. Skip next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. 40 reps of (3 dc, ch 4, tr).
3rd rnd:  Sl st in each st to next ch-4 sp. Ch 8 (counts as tr and ch-4 sp). 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. (1 tr. Ch 4. 3 dc) in each ch-4 sp around. Join with sl st in 4th ch of beg ch-8.
4th rnd:  Sl st in each st to next ch-4 sp. (Ch 3. 2 dc. Ch 4. 1 tr) in same sp as last sl st *(3 dc. Ch 4. 1 tr) in each ch-4 sp around. Join with sl st in top of beg ch-3.
5th to 12th rnds: Rep 3rd and 4th rnds 4 times more.
Edging: 13th rnd: Sl st in each st to next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. 4 dc in same sp as last sl st. (Sl st. Ch 4. 4 dc) in each ch-4 sp around. Join with sl st in in first sl st. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m) Jeweltone (7195) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® split-lock stitch count markers.
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] deep by 24" [61 cm] in circumference.
gauge: 12 sts and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Start crocheting!
• Use O’Go to self-stripe as you go.  
• Cowl is worked in continuous spiral. Do not join at end of rnds. Place marker to note beg of rnd and move each subsequent rnd.
COWL
Ch 70. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first ch. 1 hdc in each ch around. Do not join. 70 sts.
2nd rnd: 1 hdc in back loop only of first sc. *1 hdc into horizontal bar (see diagram) created below next st in prev rnd. Rep from * around. 
3rd rnd: *1 hdc into horizontal bar created below next st in prev rnd. Rep from * around. 
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 11" [28 cm].
Final rnd: *1 sc into horizontal bar created below next st in prev rnd. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
(Wrong side of work shown in diagram)

materials: RED HEART® Sweet Home™: 1 ball 514 Spruce
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 16 mm [US Q]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cowl measures approximately 6" [15 cm] wide x 36" [91 cm] circumference. One size fits most.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
COWL 
Ch 46, slip stitch in first chain to join in a ring, taking care not to twist sts. 
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1 here and throughout), [skip next ch, dc in next ch, ch 1] round to last ch, skip last ch, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 – 23 dc and 23 ch-1 space. 
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each dc and ch-1 space around – 46 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 4, [skip next sc, dc in next sc, ch 1] round to last sc, skip last sc, slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4 – 23 dc and 23 ch-1 space. 
Rounds 4-5: Repeat Rounds 2-3. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING 
Weave in ends.

materials: Patons® Cobbles™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 41 yds/37 m) Frosted Plum (85315) 2 balls
Size U.S. Q/19 (15 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times in indicated space. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx. 9" [23 cm] wide x 30" [76 cm] around.
gauge: 4 sc and 4½ rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 32. Join in rnd with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 2. (Yoh and draw up a loop) twice in first ch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – beg cluster made. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. Cluster in next ch. Rep from * to last ch. Ch 1. Skip last ch. Join with sl st in top of beg cluster.
2nd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Beg cluster in same sp. *Ch 1. Cluster in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 1. Join with sl st in top of beg cluster.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Fur™: 2 balls 9012 Slate
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 19mm [US S]
Large eye plastic needle, sewing needle and matching thread (optional)
measurements: Cowl measures 5” wide x 36” circumference (12.5 x 91.5 cm).
gauge: 4 sc = 5” (12.5 cm). Exact gauge is not critical to this project.
instructions:
Notes
1. Cowl is worked back and forth in rows and then ends are sewn together.
2. Row 2 does not begin with chain-1.
COWL
Ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—4 sc.
Row 2: Sc in each sc, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 36” (91.5 cm) long.
Joining Row: With first and last rows held together and working through both thicknesses, slip st in each sc across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. If desired, tack beginning and ending tails in place with sewing needle and thread to prevent unraveling.

materials: Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds/116 m) Main Color (MC) Coconut Cream (01001) 2 braids
Contrast Frozen Berry (01022) 1 braid
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 5 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 5 dc group. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
measurements: Approx 23½" [59.5 cm] around x 12" [30.5 cm] deep.
gauge: 12 sts and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Before working with Caron® x Pantone™ multi-shade yarn braid, separate each color link and wind into 5 separate balls.  
• Each color link will be referenced by its Pantone™ # (see ball band)
• Due to finite amount of yarn in each shade, pattern gauge must be matched to ensure successful results.
With MC, ch 70. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist.
Work Chart, noting each MC square of chart is equal to 1 dc and each Contrast square is equal to 1 Popcorn and reading all rnds from right to left. 
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each ch around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 70 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 8 dc. *Popcorn in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 9 dc. Rep from * to last st. Popcorn in last st. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 sts. *Popcorn in next st. 1 dc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Popcorn in next st. 1 dc in each of last 5 sts. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in each st around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
First 5 rnds of Chart are complete.
Cont working Chart until 21st rnd of chart is complete.
Next rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 rnd of reverse sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
Bottom edging: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to bottom edge. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 rnd of reverse sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Fair Isle®: 2 skeins 7247 Fair Isle Calm
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8mm [US L]
Yarn needle
measurements: Cowl measures 5" [13 cm] wide x 60" [152 cm] circumference.

instructions: Ch 30, slip st in first ch, taking care not to twist sts, to form a ring. Round 1: Sc into first ch and in each ch around. Round 2: Sc in each sc around. Repeat Round 2 until piece measures 60" [152 cm] from beginning, slip st in last st of last round. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. FINISHING: Sew first and last rounds together to make a circle. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Reflective™: 1 ball each 8429 Grey A, and 8704 Neon Pink B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, and B = Color A, and Color B
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cowl measures about 30" [76 cm] circumference and 6" [15 cm] high.
gauge: Three (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) shells = 4½" [11.5 cm]; 4 rounds of shells = 3" [7.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Note
1. Cowl is worked in joined rounds with right side always facing.
2. Yarn color is changed to form stripes.
COWL
With A, ch 80; taking care to not twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): With A, ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch as join (first shell made), *skip next 3 ch, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch; repeat from * to last 3 ch, skip last 3 ch; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—Twenty (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) shells.
Round 2: With A, slip st in next dc, (slip st, ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next ch-2 space, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space of each remaining shell around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off A.
Round 3: With right side facing, draw up a loop of B in ch-2 space of first shell, ch 3, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space of each remaining shell around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off B.
Round 4: With right side facing, draw up a loop of A in ch-2 space of first shell, ch 3, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same ch-2 space, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space of each remaining shell around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Rounds 5–7: Repeat Rounds 2–4.
Round 8: Repeat Round 2. Fasten off A.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Mixology Solids™: 1 ball each of 12 Black A, 10 White B
RED HEART Mixology Prints™: 1 ball 969 Moonlit Print C
RED HEART® Mixology Swirl™: 1 ball 9969 Moonlit D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 11.5 mm [US P-16]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cowl measures 30” (76 cm) circumference and 7½” (19 cm) high.
gauge: 7 sts = 4” (10 cm); 4 rows = 4” (10 cm). EXACT GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL.
instructions:
COWL
With A, ch 14.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, [ch 1, skip next ch, sc in next ch] 6 times—7 sc and 6 ch-1 spaces.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, sc in first sc, [ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next sc] 6 times.  Fasten off.
Row 5 (right side): With right side facing, draw up a loop of C in first sc of previous row, ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in same sc, [ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next sc] 6 times.
Rows 6-8: With C, repeat Rows 2-4. Fasten off.
Rows 9-32: Repeat Rows 5-8, changing color as in the following sequence: Work next 4 rows with B, 4 rows with D, 4 rows with A, 4 rows with C, 4 rows with B, and 4 rows with D. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Sew the short edges together. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Boutique Unforgettable®: 1 ball 3932 Springtime
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cowl measures 9½” wide x 30” circumference (24 x 76 cm).
gauge: 2 pattern repeats = 4” (10 cm) (one pattern repeat consists of one shell and one single crochet); 8 rows = 4” (10 cm) in shell pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COWL
Ch 92.
Foundation Row: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—91 sc.
First Side
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in first sc, *bobble in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—45 bobbles and 46 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn—91 sc. 
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *skip next 2 sc, shell in next sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—15 shells and 16 sc.
Row 4: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in first sc, *sc in center dc of next shell, shell in next sc; repeat from * across to last shell, sc in center dc of last shell, 3 dc in last sc, turn—14 shells, 15 sc, and 3 dc at each end.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first dc, shell in next sc, *sc in center dc of next shell, shell in next sc; repeat from * across to last 3 dc, skip next 2 dc, sc in last dc¬, turn—15 shells and 16 sc.
Rows 6–11: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 three times. Fasten off.
Second Side
Row 1 (wrong side): With wrong side of Foundation Row facing and working in opposite side of foundation ch, join yarn with sc in first ch, *skip next 2 ch, shell in next ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—15 shells and 16 sc.
Rows 2–9: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 of first side 4 times.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Working across ends of rows, sew short edges together. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Beyond™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 80 yds/73 m) Sand Dune Varg (23020) 5 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 19" [48.5 cm] deep x 28" [71 cm] around.
gauge: 9 stitches (sts) and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern (pat).
instructions:
Chain (ch) 45.
1st row: 1 double crochet (dc) in 4th chain (ch) from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 43 dc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in each dc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Skip first sc. 1 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Repeat (rep) 2nd and 3rd rows until work from beginning (beg) measures approximately (approx) 28" [71 cm], ending on a 2nd row. Fasten off. Sew ends together (tog) to form Cowl.
Fringe: Cut lengths of yarn 20" [51 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe around entire bottom edge of Cowl. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Bernat® Wool Up Bulky™ (6 oz/170 g; 121 yds/110 m) Aran (50008) 2 balls
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
16” [40.5 cm] long separating zipper.
Fabric marking pen.
Large eye, sharp tipped needle.
abbreviations: Sc3tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 3 indicated spaces. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 16” [40.5 cm] high x 27" [68.5 cm] around.
gauge: 7 sc and 8 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 29.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  
Ch 1. Sc3tog, drawing up first loop in 
same ch as previous sc, then in each of 
next 2 ch.  *Ch 1. Sc3tog, drawing up first 
loop in same ch as last leg of previous st, 
then in each of next 2 ch. Rep from * to 
end of row. 1 sc in same sp as last leg of 
previous st. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog, 
drawing up first loop in same sp as last 
sc, 2nd loop in top of next sc3tog, and 
3rd loop in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Sc3tog, 
drawing up first loop in same sp as last 
leg of previous sc3tog, 2nd loop in top of 
next sc3tog, and 3rd loop in next ch-1 sp. 
Rep from * to end of row. 1 sc in same sp 
as last leg of previous sc3tog. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg 
measures approx 27” [68.5 cm], ending 
on a WS row. Turn.
Edging rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each st and 
ch sp to end of row, working 3 sc in last 
sc. Do not turn. Rotate Cowl and cont 
working sc evenly across rem 3 sides, 
working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st 
to first sc. Fasten off.
Zipper
Using fabric marking pen and working 
along center of zipper tape, mark both 
sides of zipper tape with dots at ½” [1.5 
cm] intervals. Pin zipper in position. Using 
large-eyed, sharp-tipped needle and
length of yarn, sew zipper in position with 
whip stitch through each marked dot.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 506 Pool A, 625 Guava B and 3862 Jade C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6. oz; 288 m/315 yds)
Contrast A Ocean (9759) 2
Simply Soft (170 g/6. oz; 288 m/315 yds)
Contrast B Passion (0012) 1
Sizes US H-8 (5mm) or size to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
measurements: Approx. 38"/96.5cm circumference by 19"/48cm wide
gauge: 13 Fsc = 4"/10cm; In pattern, 3 shells = 3¾"/9.5cm, Rounds 1–3 = 2 3/4"/7cm (gauge is not critical for this project).
instructions:
NOTES
1. Scarf is worked in figure 8 (infinity) rounds, alternating two rounds worked with A and one round worked with B.
2. To change color, fasten off old color, and join new color as instructed.
3. Remember to turn after every round.
4. There is no obvious RS or WS to the stitch pattern or to the finished wrap.

HELPFUL
1. To work in the top of a tr4tog: After turning, the backs of the tr4tog will be facing you. The top of the tr4tog is not the loop from the last step of the tr4tog (drawn through the last 5 loops on hook), it is the loop of the ch-1 that follows and closes the cluster. So, as the row faces you, it is the chain just to the right of the body of the tr4tog.
2. To work in a chain: For stability, work each 4-tr shell into the 2nd ch of the indicated ch-3 sp, not into the space. The back of the chains will be facing you. Insert hook in the chain under the nub and through the loops of the face, under 2 strands each time.

3. For a larger or smaller circumference scarf, add or omit Fsc in multiples of 4. Each additional 4 Fsc will allow one more pattern repeat (one V-st, shell, or tr4tog) to be worked. Each pattern repeat adds about 1 1/4"/3cm to the circumference.
4. For a wider or narrower scarf, add or omit repeats of Rounds 1–3 as desired before working the edging. Each additional repeat of Rounds 1–3 adds about 5 1/2"/14cm to the width.

INSTRUCTIONS
Note: Begin with a foundation at the center, and work rounds to the edges.
With A, Fsc 128 loosely (to gauge). Turn foundation over so sc edge is on top, begin work across the sc edge.
Foundation Round: Ch 3, sk first sc, tr3tog over next 3 sc (beginning ch 3 and tr3tog counts as beginning tr4tog), [ch 4, tr4tog over next 4 sc] 31 times, turn; lay foundation flat, taking care not to twist piece yet, bring the ends together. Hold the end with the last loop in place, give a half-twist to the other end so that the chain edge of the foundation is on top; begin work across the chains, [ch 4, tr4tog over next 4 ch] 32 times, end with ch 4, sl st in top of beginning tr4tog, turn—32 tr4tog. Fasten off.
Note: There is a gap between the beginning and end of the Fsc that you can close now. Thread the beginning tail of the Fsc onto a yarn needle, loop it around the last ch of the foundation, sew back into the beginning Fsc, and if you wish, take a couple of stitches to secure the join.
Round 1: With B, Air tr in top of any tr4tog, V-st in top of each tr4tog around, end with tr in top of same tr4tog as first st, ch 3, sl st in first Air tr to complete beginning V-st, turn—64 V-sts. Fasten off.
Round 2: With A, Air tr in 2nd ch of ch-3 sp of any V-st, shell in 2nd ch of ch-3 sp of each remaining V-st around, end with 3 tr in same ch as beginning, sl st in beginning tr to complete beginning shell, turn—64 shells.
Round 3: Continue with A, ch 3, sk first tr (same tr as join), tr3tog over remaining 3 tr of beginning shell (beginning ch 3 and tr3tog counts as beginning tr4tog), *ch 4, tr4tog over 4 tr of next shell; repeat from * around, end with ch 4, sl st in top of beginning tr4tog, turn—64 tr4tog. Fasten off.
Rounds 4–9: Repeat Rounds 1–3 twice.
Edging Round: Join B with sl st in any ch-4 sp, ch 1, sc in same ch-4 sp, ch 2, Cl in top of next tr4tog, ch 2, *sc in next ch-4 sp, ch 2, Cl in top of next tr4tog; repeat from * around, end with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Using yarn needle, weave in all ends. Block wrap, as desired. Tip: It might be unwieldy to try and block this infinity shape flat.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 2 balls 4604 Navy

Susan Bates Crochet Hook®: 5.5mm [US I-9]

yarn needle

abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Cowl measures 9” (23 cm) wide x 50” (127 cm) long before joining and adding Ruffle
gauge: 15 sc = 4” (10 cm). In pattern, 10 rows = 4” (10 cm).
instructions:
COWL
Row 1: Work 31 Fsc (see Special Stitches).
Row 2 (Right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each of the next 30 sts; turn—31 dc.
Row 3: Ch 1 (does not count as a st), sc in each of the next 30 dc and top of beginning ch-3; turn—31 sc.
Row 4: Ch 3, dc in each of the next 4 sc, *Fptr (see Special Stitches) around next dc 2 rows below, BR (see Special Stitches) over next 3 dc 2 rows below, Fptr around next dc 2 rows below, dc in each of the next 3 sc; repeat from * twice, dc in each of the last 2 sc; turn—16 dc, 15 Fptr.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each of the next 30 sts and in the top of beginning ch-3; turn—31 sc.
Row 6: Ch 3, dc in each of the next 4 sc, *Fptr around next Fptr 2 rows below, BR over next 3 BR sts 2 rows below, Fptr around next dc 2 rows below, dc in each of the next 3 sc; repeat from * twice, dc in each of the last 2 sc; turn—16 dc, 15 Fptr.
Repeat Rows 5-6 until Cowl measures 50” (127 cm) long, ending on a Row 5. With Wrong side out, match sts on ends of first and last Rows and slip st ends together to join. Fasten off, weave in ends.
EDGING
Note: Open up the Sashay Sequins to smooth it out, and work into the top edge without the sequins. Start 4” (10 cm) from the end, and work into every other loop on the top edge to create the Ruffle.
Hold Sashay Sequins and Cowl with Right sides together. Insert hook where the Cowl is joined and through first loop of Sashay Sequins, draw loop up to join; *working evenly along first side of Cowl, insert hook into next st on Cowl and pull up another loop of Sashay Sequins and make a slip st; repeat from * around. Place a stitch marker in the last loop so it does not unravel. Fasten off.
Trim the Sashay Sequins, leaving a 4” (10 cm) end. Fold under raw edge of each end, use sewing needle and thread to tack down both ends of the Sashay Sequins at the joining point to secure them. Repeat for second side.

materials: Bernat® Satin (100 g/3.5 oz; 182 m/200 yds)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] deep x 44" [112 cm] around bottom edge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 150. Join in ring with sl st into first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first ch. Ch 1. Miss next ch. *1 sc in next ch. Ch 1. Miss next ch. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). Miss next sc. *1 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch.
5th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next dc) 13 times. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 ch-1 sps. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. Ch 1. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th and 7th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
8th rnd: As 4th rnd.
9th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next dc) 12 times. Sc2tog. Ch 1. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc.
10th to 13th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
14th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc) 11 times. Sc2tog. Ch 1. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc.
15th to 18th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
19th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc) 10 times. Sc2tog. Ch 1. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc.
20th to 23rd rnds: As 2nd rnd.
24th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc) 9 times. Sc2tog. Ch 1. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc.
25th to 28th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
29th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc) 8 times. Sc2tog. Ch 1. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc.
30th to 33rd rnds: As 2nd rnd.
34th rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. *(1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc) 7 times. Sc2tog. Ch 1. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc.
35th to 41st rnds: As 2nd rnd.
42nd rnd: As 4th rnd. Place marker at end of rnd.
43rd to 45th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Twisted Cord: Cut 3 strands of yarn 100" [254 cm] long. With all strands tog, hold one end and with someone holding the other end, twist strands to the right until they begin to curl. Fold the 2 ends tog and tie in a knot so they will not unravel. The strands will now twist themselves tog. Thread cord through dc and ch-1 sps of marked rnd.
Pom-pom (make 2): Wind yarn around 4 fingers approx 80 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Attach to Cord ends.
